TI THE ROLE OF STEP KINETICS IN MBE OF COMPOUND SEMICONDUCTORS
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON VAPOUR GROWTH AND EPITAXY
CY JUL 14-17, 1991
CL NAGOYA, JAPAN
SP JAPANESE ASSOC CRYSTAL GROWTH, JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, INT ORG CRYSTAL GROWTH
ID ENERGY ELECTRON-DIFFRACTION; MOLECULAR-BEAM EPITAXY; GROWTH; SURFACE;
   GAAS; SUBLIMATION; GAAS(001); MIGRATION
AB The degree of equilibrium at the growth step during MBE is studied taking GaAs and (In,Ga)As as examples.  The theoretical calculation with the assumption of near-equilibrium at the step edge gives the temperature dependence of mode transition between the 2D nucleation and the step flow on the Ga flux intensity and the inter-step distance, which agree very well with the experiments.  The (In,Ga)As MBE experiment shows that there is a segregation dependency of In on the interstep distance which means a certain amount of supersaturation exists even at the step edge.  The theory predicts that the supersaturation ratio is of the order of 1.5 at the step edge.  From these experimental results and theoretical considerations, it is concluded that equilibrium or near-equilibrium is established at the step edge.  The experiments with nonplanar substrate, which gave a very long diffusion length for atom incorporation, are discussed and it is suggested that the origin of the disagreement with the present model can be explained in terms of a large lateral flux in the growth on the nonplanar substrate.
RP NISHINAGA, T (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECTR ENGN,7-3-1 HONGO,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
CR HATA M, 1990, J VAC SCI TECHNOL B, V8, P692, DOI 10.1116/1.584997

   LATYSHEV AV, 1989, SURF SCI, V213, P157, DOI 10.1016/0039-6028(89)90256-2

TI GROWTH-MECHANISM OF 3C-SIC LAYERS AT A LOW-TEMPERATURE REGION IN
   LOW-PRESSURE CVD
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON VAPOUR GROWTH AND EPITAXY
CY JUL 14-17, 1991
CL NAGOYA, JAPAN
SP JAPANESE ASSOC CRYSTAL GROWTH, JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, INT ORG CRYSTAL GROWTH
AB The growth mechanism of 3C-SiC layers on Si substrates in the temperature region lower than 1300-degrees-C has been studied in low-pressure CVD using SiH4 and C2H2 as source gases.  The growth rate is dominated by the flow rate of SiH4 and is independent of that of C2H2.  Stoichiometric SiC layers grow independent of the source gas composition ratio of SiH4 up to 90%.  The growth mechanism is considered as follows:  Adsorption of silicon atoms occurs onto the carbon covered surface and this leads some silicon to form SiC molecules and the rest to desorb from the surface.  Layers with high crystallinity are grown when the growth rate is controlled to be within 4 nm/min at 1150-degrees-C.  This was achieved by controlling the SiH4 supply.
C1 NAGOYA INST TECHNOL,DEPT ELECT & COMP ENGN,GOKISO,NAGOYA,AICHI 466,JAPAN.

TI HIGH GAS SENSITIVITY OF TIN OXIDE ULTRATHIN FILMS DEPOSITED ON GLASSES
   AND ALUMINA SUBSTRATES
SO JOURNAL OF MATERIALS SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article
ID BEAM SPUTTERING APPARATUS; THICKNESS
AB Tin oxide ultrathin films were deposited on optically flat Pyrex glass, optically flat quartz glass and sintered alumina substrates by the ion-beam sputtering method. Films with thickness varying from about 1 to 500 nm were annealed in air at 500-degrees-C for 50 h. The gas sensing properties of these films were investigated at 300-degrees-C against synthetic air containing 0.5% hydrogen. A small substrate dependence of sensor behaviour was observed; however, an overwhelmingly important thickness dependence occurred in all substrates tried. Sensitivities higher than approximately 10(4) or 10(5) were obtained in films in a narrow thickness range of about 3 to 20 nm, and films thicker or thinner than this were relatively insensitive.
RP SUZUKI, T (reprint author), TOKYO UNIV AGR & TECHNOL,FAC TECHNOL,DEPT APPL CHEM,KOGANEI,TOKYO 184,JAPAN.

TI QUASI-EQUILIBRIUM OF STAINLESS-STEEL IN A NONISOTHERMAL SODIUM LOOP
   CONSTRUCTED OF TYPE-316 STAINLESS-STEEL
SO JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article
ID LIQUID-SODIUM; CORROSION; ENVIRONMENT; CHROMIUM; SYSTEM
AB Quasi-equilibrium of stainless steel in a sodium environment is studied using specimens of three kinds of Fe-(5, 7 or 9)Cr-1Mo-0.1C(wt%) martensitic/ferritic steels and a maximum isothermal region in a sodium loop constructed of a commercial Type 316 stainless steel. The weight loss, the composition of metallic elements near the surface, and the average carbon content for the specimens exposed to sodium of 700-degrees-C, 1-2 wppm oxygen level, and 4.0 m/s velocity are determined as a function of exposure time of the specimens. From the present results and the previous results at 650 and 600-degrees-C, it may be concluded that the contents of iron, chromium and nickel in stainless steel in quasi-equilibrium are Fe- approximately 5Cr- < 1Ni at 700-degrees-C, Fe- approximately 6Cr- < 1Ni at 650-degrees-C, and Fe- approximately 7Cr- < 1Ni at 600-degrees-C. The nickel in stainless steel will directly dissolve in the sodium according to the solubility of nickel, while the iron and chromium will predominantly react with the sodium containing 1-2 wppm oxygen and dissolve in the sodium in the maximum isothermal region of the loop according to the reactions Fe(or Cr)[s] + Na+-O2- cluster[1] --> Na-Fe(or Cr)-O[1]. On the basis of the quasi-equilibrium compositions, it appears that the free energy change in the reaction for the formation of Na-Cr-O complex is more negative than that of Na-Fe-O complex, and that the buffering action of chromium for oxygen in sodium, which would lower the corrosion of stainless steel in sodium, is confirmed.
RP SUZUKI, T (reprint author), NATL RES INST MET,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI PREPARATION OF ANTIMONYL ACID CATION-EXCHANGE MEMBRANES BY USING SOL-GEL
   METHOD
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
AB A new inorganic cation-exchange membrane was successfully prepared on a microporous alumina substrate by dipcoating an antimonic acid sol solution obtained from a mixture of antimonic acid sol:Si(OC2H5)4:H2O:C2H5OH:HCl = 0.06:1:11:6.8:0.068 in molar ratio.
   The thickness, resistivity and ion-exchange capacity of the membrane increased with an increase in the number of dipcoated times, while the limiting current density showed a tendency to decrease.
   The ion-exchange capacity, area resistivity, limiting current density and transport number of Na+ for the 10 times coated membrane were 0.0061 meq.cm-2, 186.2 OMEGA.cm2, 0.96 A.dm-2 and 0.70, respectively.
   The membranes could stand in 6 M hydrochloric acid or nitric acid aqueous solution at 80-degrees-C for 24 h without any change in ion-exchange capacity.
C1 YAMANASHI UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL CHEM & BIOL TECHNOL,KOFU,YAMANASHI 400,JAPAN.
   YOKOHAMA NATL UNIV,DEPT MAT SCI & CHEM ENGN,HODOGAYA KU,YOKOHAMA,KANAGAWA 240,JAPAN.

TI SUPERCONDUCTIVITY IN SR(LN)-NB-O SYSTEM (LN-LA,ND,PR,CE,GD AND HO)
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PERFECTURE
AB A new non-Cu oxide superconductor Sr(Ln)-Nb-O system (Ln:La,Nd,Pr,Ce,Gd and Ho) has been found by the resistivity and magnetization measurements.  The highest onset transition temperature is about 12K.  Preliminary electron and X-ray diffraction experiments indicate that main phase (approximately 90%) in this system is (Sr1-xLnx)Nb2O6-delta and another impurity phase (approximately 10%) is (Sr1-xLnx)2Nb2O7-delta, suggesting that the basic crystal structure is probably an oxygen deficient CaTa2O6 type structure.

TI PHOTOEMISSION-STUDY ON BA1-XKXBIO3-DELTA AND BAPBXBI1-XO3-DELTA
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PREFECTURE
ID ELECTRONIC-STRUCTURE; BAPB1-XBIXO3
AB The well characterized surfaces of Ba1-xKxBiO3-delta and BaPbxBi1-xO3-delta are investigated by x-ray and ultraviolet photoelectron spectroscopies (XPS and UPS).  The clear Fermi edge is found for the fractured surfaces of Ba0.5K0.5BiO3-delta and BaPb0.75Bi0.25O3-delta using XPS and He I UPS.  The valence band shift toward the Fermi level (E(F)) by about 0.4 eV with doping K and Pb is observed.  The results are compared with the band calculation.

TI ANISOTROPIC COUPLING BETWEEN HIGH-TC SUPERCONDUCTIVITY AND LATTICE IN
   SINGLE-CRYSTALLINE LA1.86SR0.14CUO4
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PREFECTURE
ID TRANSITION
AB The longitudinal elastic constants in high-quality single crystals La1.86Sr0.14CuO4 were measured across the superconducting transition temperature T(c) under magnetic fields up to 14T applied both parallel and normal to the CuO2-plane.  We found anomalies of elastic constants at T(c), indicating the anisotropic coupling between the high-T(c) superconductivity and lattice.  We newly found anomalies below 4K under high field, suggesting the field induced instability of the lattice.

TI MODIFIED SPIN-WAVE ANALYSIS OF MULTI-MAGNON EXCITATIONS IN RAMAN-SPECTRA
   FOR QUANTUM HEISENBERG AF SYSTEMS ON A SQUARE LATTICE WITH WITHOUT
   FRUSTRATION
SO PHYSICA C
LA English

CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
AB Magnon lines for Stokes shift in the frustrated quantum antiferromagnetic system on a square lattice, where the sub-lattice magnetization vanishes, are calculated by the method of the modified spin wave on the basis of the exchange scattering process.  The obtained main peak is essentially accompanied by the side peak whose origin is four magnon process including one magnon condensed at k = 0.

TI PROPERTIES OF YBCO FILMS PREPARED BY PURE ARGON SPUTTERING
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY HIGH
   TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS 3
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
AB Behavior of oxygen during the deposition process was investigated by an rf magnetron sputtering method with pure Ar gas.  Although pure Ar gas was used as a sputtering gas, Y1Ba2Cu3Ox(YBCO) films deposited in the pressure region from 0.2 to 2Pa showed superconductivity.  It suggests that sufficient oxygen to form the superconducting structure at a low gas pressure around 1Pa was supplied from the target.

TI ENHANCED SUPERCONDUCTIVITY DUE TO MAGNETIC-FIELD IN AU/GE MULTILAYERS
SO PHYSICA C
LA English

   TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS 3

ID THIN
AB The temperature dependence of parallel critical field was measured for sandwiched (Ge/Au/Ge) films.  The critical temperature was enhanced for films with Au-thickness around 10 angstrom. TI OBSERVATION OF OXYGEN IN YBCO THIN-FILMS DURING THE COOLING DOWN PROCESS
   USING O-18 TRACER
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY HIGH
   TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS 3
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
ID SINGLE
AB We studied the behavior of the oxygen in the YBa2Cu3Ox films using O-18 as a tracer.  Pure O-18(2) gas was introduced into a chamber during deposition.  Then it was changed for O-16(2) gas in the subsequent cooling down process.  Though YBCO films absolutely contained only O-18 atoms in their oxygen sites during growth process, almost all O-18 atoms were replaced with O-16 atoms while the films were cooled down; 95% of O-18 atoms were substituted using rf-plasma, and 85% of O-18 atoms without the plasma.  It shows that rf-plasma strongly affected the oxygenation of the YBCO films even in the cooling process.
RP TSUDA, K (reprint author), FUJI ELECT CORP RES & DEV LTD,2-2-1 NAGASAKA,YOKOSUKA,KANAGAWA 24001,JAPAN.

TI POLARIZED DEUTERON SCATTERING AS A PROBE FOR SPIN-DEPENDENT RESPONSE
   FUNCTIONS IN NUCLEI
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID OBSERVABLES
AB Inelastic scattering of polarized deuterons is considered as a probe to study nuclear spin-dependent response functions. Partial spin-transfer cross sections are defined and are expressed in terms of polarization transfer coefficients. Relationship between spin observables and nuclear response functions is studied in the plane wave impulse approximation.

TI LOW-COST SILICON SHEETS PRODUCED BY NEW SPIN CAST PROCESS
SO SOLAR ENERGY MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON PHOTOVOLTAIC SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING ( PVSEC-5
   ) : RECENT TOPICS ON SOLAR PHOTOVOLTAIC MATERIALS
CY NOV 26-30, 1990
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
AB A new spin cast process to mass-produce polycrystalline silicon sheets for low-cost and reasonable efficiency solar cells has been developed, and new equipment for mass-production has been constructed.  In the preliminary process, it was difficult to achieve high throughput and reasonable efficiency at the same time.  Using the new process high quality silicon sheets can be produced with a production rate of 15 s/sheet, because a low physical growth rate was maintained in each sheet in spite of high throughput.  An average solar cell efficiency of over 13% was obtained.

TI AMORPHOUS CE-SI ALLOYS - NEW HEAVY FERMION SYSTEM
SO SOLID STATE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID DENSE KONDO SYSTEM; MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES
AB Bulk amorphous CexSi1-x alloys have been successfully produced by a high rate sputtering method.  Remarkable enhancement in their electronic specific heat coefficient and Pauli paramagnetic susceptibility at low temperatures indicate amorphous CexSi1-x alloys to be a heavy-fermion system.  Their electrical resistivity is very large and reveals the Kondo type logarithmic temperature dependence, however, it displays no T2 dependence at low temperatures.  The formation of Kondo lattice and ferromagnetic ordering are suppressed by the random atom stacking in the amorphous Ce-Si alloys.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
RP HIHARA, T (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI REACTION OF DIMERIZED NOX (X = 1 OR 2) WITH SO2 IN A RESTRICTED
   SLIT-SHAPED MICROPORE SPACE
SO JOURNAL OF PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY
LA English
DT Article
ID ACTIVATED CARBON-FIBERS; SUPERCRITICAL NO; NITRIC-OXIDE; TEMPERATURE;
   DISPROPORTIONATION
AB The reaction of dimerized NO or NO2 with SO2 in a slit-shaped micropore of alpha-FeOOH dispersed activated carbon fiber (ACF) at 273-373 K was examined using IR spectroscopy, alpha-FeOOH particles on ACF were ultrafine and strongly interacted with the carbon surface as examined by EXAFS and XPS.  The micropore width of the ACF was 0.9 nm irrespective of dispersion of alpha-FeOOH by high-resolution N2 adsorption measurements.  Significant amounts of NO molecules can be adsorbed in the micropore in the form of a dimer and react with adsorbed SO2 molecules in the micropore to produce N2O.  The effects of reaction temperature, gas composition of NO and SO2, and dispersion of alpha-FeOOH on the N2O formation were examined; the reaction was governed by the amount of NO adsorption in the micropore.  The N2O formation arose from the disproportionation reaction of the dimerized NO to N2O and NO2 (3(NO2) = 2NO2 + 2N2O), where coexisting SO2 enhanced the reaction through depletion of NO2 by the reaction of NO2 + SO2 = NO + SO3.  Formation of SO3 in the micropore was confirmed by diffuse reflectance FTIR measurement.  In the case of the reaction of the dimerized NO2 with SO2 in the micropore, also N2O and SO3 were produced via intermediate (NO)2.  Thus, the slit-shaped micropore can induce the high-pressure reaction of the disproportionation reaction of (NO2) even under moderate conditions.
C1 CHIBA UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,CHIBA 260,JAPAN.
CR AGNEW SF, 1985, J PHYS CHEM-US, V89, P1678, DOI 10.1021/j100255a026
   ARMITAGE JW, 1971, COMBUST FLAME, V16, P125, DOI 10.1016/S0010-2180(71)80077-9
   Barber M., 1973, Journal of the Chemical Society Faraday Transactions II, V69, DOI 10.1039/f29736900559
   BOWERS C, 1989, J PHYS CHEM-US, V93, P2596, DOI 10.1021/j100343a069
   BRICKER OP, 1989, ENVIRON SCI TECHNOL, V23, P379, DOI 10.1021/es00181a001
   CARROTT PJM, 1988, CHARACTERIZATION POR, P89
   CHAO CC, 1971, J AM CHEM SOC, V93, P71, DOI 10.1021/ja00730a013
   CHEDIN A, 1976, J MOL SPECTROSC, V63, P348, DOI 10.1016/0022-2852(76)90302-7
   DUBININ MM, 1987, CARBON, V25, P593, DOI 10.1016/0008-6223(87)90208-9
   ENAULT A, 1977, SURF SCI, V62, P233, DOI 10.1016/0039-6028(77)90440-X
   GREGG SJ, 1982, ADSORPTION SURFACE A, pCH4

AB The synthesis of a new family of spheroidal carbon molecules derived from the fullerenes is described. TI SOLUBILITIES OF ETHANOL, 1-PROPANOL, 2-PROPANOL AND 1-BUTANOL IN
   SUPERCRITICAL CARBON-DIOXIDE AT 313-K AND 333-K
SO FLUID PHASE EQUILIBRIA
LA English
DT Article
ID VAPOR-LIQUID-EQUILIBRIUM
AB Using a flow-type apparatus for supercritical fluid extraction, solubilities of an alcohol in supercritical CO2 have been measured at 313 K and 333 K up to 11 MPa. Ethanol, 1-propanol, 2-propanol and 1-butanol were selected as the alcohols. Consistency of the obtained solubility data was tested by the enhancement factor method, which showed good consistency for all systems.
   The logarithmic values of the enhancement factors for all the alcohols were observed to be linear functions of pure CO2 density. Employing this linear relationship, the solubility of an alcohol in supercritical CO2 can easily be determined with high accuracy.
RP SUZUKI, T (reprint author), TOKYO METROPOLITAN UNIV, DEPT IND CHEM, 1-1 MANAMIOHSAWA, HACHIOJI, TOKYO 19203, JAPAN.

TI GAUGE-FIXING AMBIGUITY AND MONOPOLE NUMBER
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID CONFINEMENT MECHANISM; QUARK CONFINEMENT; CONDENSATION; TOPOLOGY
AB Gauge-fixing ambiguities of lattice SU (2) QCD are studied in the maximally abelian and unitary gauges. In the former, we find local maxima of a gauge-fixing function which may correspond to Gribov copies. There is a definite anti-correlation between the number of monopoles and the value of the function. Errors of measured quantities coming from the ambiguity are found to be less than inherent dispersion in the ensemble average. No ambiguity is found in the unitary gauges.

TI EFFECT OF POLYMER MATRIX ON THE OXYGEN DIFFUSION VIA A COBALT PORPHYRIN
   FIXED IN A MEMBRANE
SO MACROMOLECULES
LA English
DT Article
ID DUAL-MODE TRANSPORT; MOLECULAR-OXYGEN; GLASSY-POLYMERS; COMPLEXES;
   CARRIER
AB Specific and facilitated transport of molecular oxygen through a polymer membrane containing [alpha-mono(o-methacrylamidophenyl)-alpha,alpha,alpha-tris(o-pivalamidophenyl)porphinato]cobalt (CoMPP) complex as a fixed oxygen carrier is analyzed by a modified dual-mode transport theory, and the effect of the polymer matrix on the oxygen diffusion via the fixed carrier is discussed.  Oxygen diffusion coefficients for the diffusion from the polymer matrix to the fixed carrier (D(DC)) and for the diffusion from the fixed carrier to the polymer matrix (D(CD)) increase with physical diffusivity through the polymer matrix.  In contrast, the oxygen diffusion coefficient for hopping between the fixed carriers (D(CC)) is independent of the polymer matrix species.
C1 WASEDA UNIV,DEPT POLYMER CHEM,TOKYO 169,JAPAN.

AU SUZUKI, T
   MOTOMURA, Y

AF SUZUKI, T
   MOTOMURA, Y
   TAGAMI, K
TI OFFTRACK CHARACTERISTICS OF SHIELDED MAGNETORESISTIVE HEAD
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON MAGNETICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH JOINT MMM-INTERMAG CONF
CY JUN 18-21, 1991
CL PITTSBURGH, PA
SP AKASHIC MEMORIES, ALLEGHENY LUDLUM, ALLIED SIGNAL, APPL MAGNET, ARMCO, ANORD ENGN, BASF AG, CERAM MAGNET, CRUCIBLE MAT, DASTEK
AB The shielded magnetoresistive (MR) head offtrack profile shows a wide output plateau which follows the conventional offtrack roll off curve.  The authors have investigated the origin of the unique offtrack characteristics and their influence on crosstalk S/N ratio (SNR), based on experimental and magnetic calculation results.  In the measurement, 8-mu-m track width MR heads were used, which consist of a pair of 100-mu-m shields and a trilayered MR element between shields.  The plateau width is close to the shield width.  The output in the plateau region is the sum of the contributed outputs from individual tracks under the shield.  Therefore, this output can severely reduce the crosstalk SNR when the MR head includes several tracks under the shield.  Magnetic calculation shows that the magnetic flux from the recorded track to the MR element through the shields can produce the output at the plateau region.  Further examination shows that crosstalk SNR is improved by increasing the shield thickness and/or by decreasing the shield width.  Therefore, in order to realize high track density, shield optimization is important.
RP SUZUKI, T (reprint author), NEC CORP LTD,FUNCT DEVICES RES LABS,KAWASAKI 216,JAPAN.
CR HUNT RP, 1971, IEEE T MAGN, VMAG7, P150, DOI 10.1109/TMAG.1971.1067019

TI PREPARATION AND EVALUATION OF EUDRAGIT GELS .2. INVITRO RELEASE OF
   SALICYLIC-ACID, SODIUM-SALICYLATE, AND KETOPROFEN FROM EUDRAGIT-L AND
   EUDRAGIT-S ORGANOGELS
SO JOURNAL OF PHARMACEUTICAL SCIENCES
LA English
DT Article
ID PLURONIC F-127 GELS; DRUG RELEASE
AB The in vitro dissolution characteristic of salicylic acid, sodium salicylate, and ketoprofen from Eudragit L and S organogels was investigated by the rotation disk method.  The dissolution pattern of salicylic acid and erosion of Eudragit L polymer from the organogels followed apparent zero-order kinetics, providing strong evidence for a surface erosion mechanism and negligible diffusional release of salicylic acid.  On the other hand, the dissolution of salicylic acid from Eudragit S organogels was a linear function of the square root of time.  The apparent dissolution rate of salicylic acid from Eudragit S organogels increased with increasing temperature from 32 to 42-degrees-C and agitation rate from 50 to 200 rpm.  A linear relationship was obtained between the logarithm of apparent dissolution rate constants and the reciprocal of absolute temperatures.  The activation energy for release of salicylic acid from Eudragit S organogels was in the range of 2.99 to 5.57 kcal/mol.  From various experimental results, it was concluded that the release process of salicylic acid from Eudragit S organogels was diffusion controlled through the organogels matrix.
C1 KYUSHU UNIV,FAC PHARMACEUT SCI,3-1-1 MAIDASHI,HIGASHI KU,FUKUOKA 812,JAPAN.

TI EFFECT OF DETERGENT ATTACHED TO ENZYME MOLECULES ON THE ACTIVITY OF
   ORGANIC-SOLVENT-SOLUBLE LIPASES
SO JOURNAL OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY-PERKIN TRANSACTIONS 2
LA English
DT Article
AB In our previous work, the organic-solvent-soluble enzyme (lipase B) was prepared in high yield using a synthetic detergent. Using this method, lipases from various origins have been solubilized in organic solvents with several kinds of detergent and the influence of detergent attached to the enzyme molecule on the reactivity of the organic-solvent-soluble lipase was investigated. The activities of the organic-solvent-soluble lipases have been compared in a homogeneous solvent system, tetrahydrofuran containing 20% buffer. It is shown that the hydrolysis rate of the organic-solvent-soluble lipase is affected by the nature of the surrounding detergent and that the organic-solvent-soluble lipase prepared from a detergent with a large hydrophobic region hydrolyses hydrophobic substrates more rapidly than that prepared from a detergent with a small hydrophobic region.

TI SURFACE CHARACTERIZATION OF TITANATED ALPHA-FE2O3
SO LANGMUIR
LA English
DT Article
ID METAL-OXIDES; CHEMISORPTION; WATER; FEOOH; TRANSITION; NO
AB The surface hydroxyls of synthetic alpha-Fe2O3 were partially replaced with a titanate coupling reagent at 303 K.  The ratio of the titanated hydroxyls to surface hydroxyls was 0.2.  The t-plot analyses of the N2 adsorption isotherms indicated that half of the surface area comes from micropores.  The titanation lowered the amounts of adsorbed water, nitrogen, benzene, and 1-propanol; the greater the molecular size of the adsorptive molecule, the smaller the amount of adsorption.  These adsorption data showed that the surface fractal dimensions of untreated and titanated alpha-Fe2O3 samples are 2.4 and 3.0, respectively.  Thus, the titanation provided marked roughness to the alpha-Fe2O3 surface.  The titanated alpha-Fe2O3 disperses stably in benzene, whereas untreated alpha-Fe2O3 did not disperse in benzene, but in water.  The difference in the surface states of the untreated and titanated alpha-Fe2O3 samples was examined by contact potential difference, electrical conductivity, and Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy under various water vapor pressures.  These examinations showed that water molecules build both solid- and liquidlike adsorbed layers over the surface of the untreated alpha-Fe2O3, while they form a liquidlike adsorbed layer between the alkyl chains of the titanates on the titanated surface.
C1 CHIBA UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,1-33 YAYOI,CHIBA 260,JAPAN.

TI IMPROVEMENT IN OXIDATION RESISTANCE OF THE TI-31-APPROXIMATELY-39
   MASS-PERCENT-AL ALLOYS BY HEAT-TREATMENT UNDER A LOW PARTIAL-PRESSURE
   OXYGEN ATMOSPHERE
SO MATERIALS TRANSACTIONS JIM
LA English
DT Article
DE INTERMETALLIC COMPOUND; TIAL; OXIDATION RESISTANCE; CYCLIC OXIDATION;
   HEAT TREATMENT
AB The heat treatment under a low partial pressure oxygen atmosphere has previously been developed to get an excellent oxidation resistance of intermetallic compound TiAl in the cyclic oxidation test at 900-degrees-C.  In this study, oxidation behaviors of Ti-31 approximately 39 mass% Al alloys and Ti-36 mass% Al alloys with different oxygen contents up to 0.38 mass% were investigated in cyclic oxidation tests at 900 and 950-degrees-C from a viewpoint of the effect of the heat treatment stated above.  The mass gain due to cyclic oxidation test of the specimens without the heat treatment decreased with increasing the aluminum content of the alloy, while it was independent of the oxygen content at 900 and 950-degrees-C.  The specimens with higher oxygen contents than 0.12 mass%, however, were found to form oxide TiO2 even at such a low temperature as 700-degrees-C.  The effect of the heat treatment was reduced at 950-degrees-C tests.  The higher the aluminum content of the alloy, the longer the duration in which the excellent oxidation resistance was maintained in the cyclic test.  The heat treatment at 1000-degrees-C improved the oxidation resistance of the alloys containing oxygen up to 0.12 mass%, and was not effective for higher oxygen alloys.  The optimum condition of the heat treatment under a low partial pressure oxygen atmosphere was concluded to be a vicinity of a temperature of 975-degrees-C and an air pressure of 1.3 x 10(-3) Pa for 16 h.

TI BEHAVIOR OF THE SUPERCONDUCTIVITY CHARACTERISTICS OF THE BI SYSTEM
   DURING WATER SOAKING
SO SUPERCONDUCTOR SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
ID CU
AB Samples of a bulk Bi-Pb-Sr-Ca-Cu-O system and a thick film of the Bi-Sr-Ca-Cu-O system are soaked in distilled water and the change in the superconductivity characteristics is measured. For the bulk samples, the maximum magnetization in the magnetization curve and the critical current density increase for the first 18 hours of soaking and then decrease during the subsequent soaking time. The critical temperature shows monotonic decrease throughout the soaking. A thick-film sample is almost the same as a bulk sample, i.e., the critical current density of the thick film first tends to increase for a short time due to its greater surface area then tends to decrease during the subsequent soaking. The critical temperature of the film sample also shows a slight deterioration as a result of the water soaking.

TI PREPARATION AND PROPERTIES OF TETRACYANOQUINODIMETHANE RADICAL-ANION
   SALTS WITH AZAAZULENIUM AND DIAZAAZULENIUM IONS
SO SYNTHETIC METALS
LA English
DT Article
ID TCNQ
AB 1-Aza- and 1,3-diazaazulenium ions, stable heterocyclic cations, were easily prepared.  They afforded conducting salts of tetracyanoquinodimethane radical anions (TCNQ.-) by metathesis with Li+TCNQ.-.  Some salts exhibit good conductivities despite 1:1 salts.  The nitrile stretching frequencies of the salts obtained here are not linearly correlated with the degrees of charge transfer due to strong interactions between the nitrile groups and heteroatoms of the cations.  X-ray structural analysis of 2-imino-3-thia-1-azaazulenium-TCNQ salt reveals the novel crystal structure in which a ribbon-like network is formed by short interheteroatom contacts and hydrogen bondings.

TI INTERFACIAL COMPATIBILITY IN CERAMIC-FIBER-REINFORCED METAL COMPOSITES
SO MATERIALS SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING A-STRUCTURAL MATERIALS PROPERTIES
   MICROSTRUCTURE AND PROCESSING
LA English
DT Article
ID MATRIX CHEMICAL INTERACTIONS; COATED GRAPHITE FIBERS; MODEL COMPOSITES;
   MECHANICAL-PROPERTIES; HIGH-TEMPERATURES; SILICON-CARBIDE; ALUMINA
   FIBERS; COPPER-ALLOYS; CARBON-FIBER; WETTABILITY
AB With four typical kinds of ceramic-reinforced metal (CFRM) composite system (C-Al, Al2O3-Al, C-Cu and SiC-Al) the interfacial compatibility and relevant problems have been reviewed and the problems of interfacial compatibility are categorized into two types: "chemical" and "mechanical" problems. The former involves such factors as the wettability at the interface between the fibres and the metal matrix and the way to improve this, whereas the latter involves such features as the influence of the interfacial reaction on the fibres and the composite strength and the method of suppressing the overreaction at the interface. The interfacial reaction in itself has contradictive aspects which are in turn advantageous and non-advantageous to the composite. The compromise between these conflicting effects of the interfacial reaction is one of the important themes in developing CFRM composites of high quality for practical usage. Because of this, it is necessary to make a much more theoretical study combining the aspects of both the chemical and the mechanical compatibilities between the fibre and the matrix, as hitherto they have been studied separately.
C1 TOKYO INST TECHNOL,DEPT MET ENGN,MEGURO KU,TOKYO 152,JAPAN.
RP SHINODA, T (reprint author), TOKYO INST TECHNOL,PRECIS & INTELLIGENCE LAB,MIDORI KU,YOKOHAMA,KANAGAWA 227,JAPAN.

TI DETERMINATION OF THE GAMMA SOLVUS SURFACE IN NI-AL-X TERNARY-SYSTEMS
SO MATERIALS SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING A-STRUCTURAL MATERIALS PROPERTIES
   MICROSTRUCTURE AND PROCESSING
LA English
DT Article
AB A systematic investigation was carried out to determine the gamma-solvus in Ni-Al-X ternary systems with X being a transition metal or subgroup B-element. Differential thermal analysis (DTA) was employed as a major experimental technique for this purpose, by which the gamma-solvus can be obtained as a surface with respect to the composition and temperature. Chemical analyses using energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy not only proved that the results obtained by DTA are highly accurate but also provided additional information on the phase relations such as the constitution of the three-phase triangle neighbouring the gamma-gamma' two-phase field.
C1 TOKYO INST TECHNOL,DEPT MAT SCI & ENGN,MIDORI KU,YOKOHAMA,KANAGAWA 227,JAPAN.
   TOKYO INST TECHNOL,DEPT MET ENGN,MEGURO KU,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

AU SUZUKI, T

AF SUZUKI, T
   MISHIMA, Y
   MIURA, S
TI EVALUATION OF THE DATA FOR THE PLASTIC BEHAVIOR OF NI-3 (AL, X)
   SINGLE-CRYSTALS
SO MATERIALS SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING A-STRUCTURAL MATERIALS PROPERTIES
   MICROSTRUCTURE AND PROCESSING
LA English
DT Article
ID POSITIVE TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE; FLOW-STRESS; ORIENTATION DEPENDENCE;
   YIELD STRESS; STRAIN-RATE; FRACTURE-BEHAVIOR; STRENGTH; NI3AL;
   DEFORMATION; ALLOYS
AB All the available shear stress data for various kinds of L1(2) single crystals which have been reviewed in 1989 are revised with the recent progress obtained with the last 2 years. Most of the findings in that review are strengthened further by the introduction of new data. Besides this, it is pointed out that the shear stress of L1(2) compounds such as Ni3Ge and Ni3Si with a strong positive temperature dependence of strength have a tendency not to obey Schmid's law at low temperatures. At elevated temperatures, it is shown that the relation between shear stress and shear strain for the steady state stress obtained in the constant-strain-rate test and the strain rate obtained in the constant-load test, i.e. the creep test, can be expressed by a single straight line. The composition dependence of the creep resistance in Ni3Al is the most interesting result found. The creep resistance increases with increasing nickel concentration on both sides of stoichiometry but the value extrapolated to stoichiometry from the nickel-rich side is much larger than that extrapolated from the aluminium-rich side. The problems which must be solved in this field are suggested.

TI 2-WAVELENGTH SINUSOIDAL PHASE MODULATING LASER-DIODE INTERFEROMETER
   INSENSITIVE TO EXTERNAL DISTURBANCES
SO APPLIED OPTICS
LA English
DT Article
AB We describe a two-wavelength laser-diode interferometer that is insensitive to external disturbances such as fluctuations in the wavelength of the laser diode and mechanical vibrations of the optical components.  In sinusoidal phase-modulating interferometry this insensitivity is easily obtained by controlling the injection current of the laser diode with a feedback control system.  Using an equivalent wavelength of 152-mu-m provided by two single-frequency laser diodes, we can measure the distance, rotation angle, and surface profile measurements with great accuracy.
RP SASAKI, O (reprint author), NIIGATA UNIV,FAC ENGN,8050 IKARASHI 2,NIIGATA 95021,JAPAN.

TI EFFECT OF CIMETIDINE ON THE MUCOSAL HYDROXYPROLINE CONTENT OF RAT
   GASTRIC-LESIONS INDUCED BY COMPOUND-48/80
SO ARZNEIMITTEL-FORSCHUNG/DRUG RESEARCH
LA English
DT Article
DE ANTIULCER DRUGS; CAS-51481-61-9; CIMETIDINE, PHARMACOLOGY; GASTRIC
   MUCOSAL LESIONS, EXPERIMENTAL
ID HISTAMINE RECEPTORS; CELLS
AB Extensive gastric mucosal lesions developed in rats after the administration of compound 48/80 at a dose of 0.75 mg/kg daily for 3 days.  The hydroxyproline content of gastric mucosa was significantly increased 4 h after the last injection of compound 48/80, and subsequently decreased as the lesions healed.  Treatment with cimetidine (CAS 51481-61-9) at a dose of 50 mg/kg (twice a day for 3 days) did not affect either the development or the healing of the compound 48/80-induced gastric lesions.  However, the increase in mucosal hydroxyproline content was significantly reduced by treatment with cimetidine.  This fact suggests that cimetidine might have an inhibitory effect on the regeneration of collagen in gastric mucosa.

TI STRUCTURE AND HOMOGENEOUS CHEMICAL-EQUILIBRIA OF LITHIUM
   BETA-DIKETONATES IN DIMETHYL-SULFOXIDE
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID BIS(BETA-DIKETONATO)NICKEL(II) COMPLEXES; DIMETHYLSULFOXIDE;
   BIS(HEXAFLUOROACETYLACETONATO)NICKEL(II); BEHAVIOR
AB The structure and the homogeneous chemical equilibria of lithium beta-diketonates (LiL), viz., Li(dbm), Li(bzac), and Li(acac), in dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) were studied by means of C-13 NMR, IR spectral measurements, and rotating disk voltammetry, where dbm-, bzac-, and acac- indicate the enolate anions of dibenzoylmethane, benzoylacetone, and acetylacetone, respectively.  It was found by the C-13 NMR and IR spectral measurements that LiL existed mainly as Li(uni-L) in DMSO, where uni- means that the ligand coordinates to the metal as unidentate.  Since it is known that LiL dissociates slightly into ions in DMSO, LiL is involved in the following homogeneous chemical equilibrium:  Li(uni-L) reversible Li+ + L- Furthermore, the apparent dissociation constant (log K(app)) of LiL was obtained by rotating disk voltammetry in DMSO containing 0.1 mol dm-3 tetrabutylammonium perchlorate (TBAP), i.e., Li(dbm):  -3.0 +/- 0.1, Li(bzac):  -2.7 +/- 0.1, and Li(acac):  -2.0 +/- 0.1, respectively.  It was noted that the homogeneous chemical equilibria shifted more to the right in 0.1 mol dm-3 TBAP-DMSO than in DMSO alone.  The behavior can be explained mainly in terms of the interaction between the pi-electron system of Li(uni-L) and the cations of TBAP.
C1 YAMAGATA UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,KOJIRAKAWA MACHI,YAMAGATA 990,JAPAN.

TI ENHANCEMENT OF SEPARATION EFFICIENCY IN A DYSPROSIUM(III) AND
   ERBIUM(III) PAIR BY THE COMBINATION OF A CHELATING RESIN WITH A
   SELECTIVE COMPLEXING AGENT
SO CHEMISTRY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB The enhancement of separation efficiency in Dy(III) and Er(III) pair has been observed by the combination of a chelating resin having amine-N-acetates group with a solution of alpha-hydroxyisobutyric acid (HIBA).  A favorable separation of Dy/Er was attained by use of the chelating resin as a column stationary phase and HIBA as an eluent.

TI ZEEMAN-EXCHANGE RELAXATION-TIME OF HCP SOLID HE-3 NEAR THE NUCLEAR
   ORDERING TEMPERATURE
SO EUROPHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB The Zeeman-exchange relaxation time tau of h.c.p. solid He-3 was obtained from the a.c. susceptibility measured in a molar volume of 19.29 cm3/mole at temperatures down to 34-mu-K.  In the lowest-temperature region tau increased with decreasing temperature, which indicates the nature of the second-order phase transition.  Below 100-mu-K, tau is found to obey the power law tau - tau-0 infinity(T - T(c))-1.37 +/- 0.07 under the assumption that the ordering temperature T(c) is equal to 12-mu-K, where tau-0 is the relaxation time at the high-temperature limit.
RP SUZUKI, T (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,DEPT PHYS,CHIKUSA KU,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

TI CALIBRATION MEASUREMENTS FOR THE EFFICIENCY AND RESPONSE FUNCTION OF THE
   NE213-SCINTILLATOR BY A CF-252 SPONTANEOUS FISSION SOURCE - APPLICATION
   OF A 2-DIMENSIONAL PULSE-HEIGHT ANALYSIS SYSTEM
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON NUCLEAR SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article
AB This paper describes calibration measurements for the efficiency and response function of the NE213 scintillator as an application of a two-dimensional pulse height analysis system. In this method, a Cf-252 spontaneous fission source with a continuous spectrum is employed by taking each fission event as a pulsed neutron source, and the efficiency and response function of the NE213 scintillator can be estimated by the two-dimensional measurements of the time-of-flight spectrum (neutron energy spectrum) and pulse height spectrum.

TI PREPARATION AND EVALUATION OF EUDRAGIT GELS .1. EUDRAGIT ORGANOGELS
   CONTAINING DRUGS AS RECTAL SUSTAINED-RELEASE PREPARATIONS
SO JOURNAL OF PHARMACEUTICAL SCIENCES
LA English
DT Article
ID LIQUID-CHROMATOGRAPHIC DETERMINATION; 1,2-PROPANEDIOL; KETOPROFEN;
   ABSORPTION; RAT
AB New organogels containing salicylic acid, sodium salicylate, procaine, and ketoprofen were prepared by using Eudragit L and S, and propylene glycol.  The physical properties (e.g., penetration and extensibility) of the organogels were affected considerably by the incorporation of a basic drug, such as procaine, rather than an acidic drug, such as salicylic acid.  In in vivo evaluation using rabbits, it was found that 30% Eudragit L organogels containing 1.25% (w/w) salicylic acid or 2.5% (w/w) ketoprofen showed sustained plasma salicylic acid or ketoprofen levels and almost the same AUC as compared with Witepsol H-15 suppositories containing these drugs.  Furthermore, the relative bioavailability for salicylic acid and ketoprofen released from 30% Eudragit L organogels, with 10% (w/w) linolic acid or oleic acid as absorption enhancer, increased to 1.55-1.75- and 1.46-1.85-fold, respectively, compared with 30% Eudragit L organogels without these unsaturated fatty acids.

TI TRANSESTERIFICATION IN POLYMER BLENDS INCLUDING POLYCARBONATE AT
   HIGH-TEMPERATURES
SO MAKROMOLEKULARE CHEMIE-MACROMOLECULAR SYMPOSIA
LA English
DT Article
ID PHASE-SEPARATION
AB Miscibility of polycarbonate (PC)/poly (arylate) (PAr) was studied by differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), phase contrast microscopy with digital image analysis (DIA) system, FT-IR spectroscopy, and cloud points for the PC/PAr/methylene chloride ternary systems. PC and PAr were immiscible over the whole composition range from the thermodynamical viewpoint. However, PC/PAr is homogenized by transesterification between PC and PAr at high temperatures. There is observed a competition between phase separation due to thermodynamical factor and phase dissolution due to transesterification. The pattern of the phase separation was spinodal decomposition type and the structure was successfully analysed by DIA.

TI SPECKLE CLIPPING CORRELATION USING VARIOUS LOGICAL OPERATIONS
SO OPTICAL ENGINEERING
LA English
DT Article
DE SPECKLE; SIGNAL CLIPPING; CORRELATION
ID INTEGRATED LASER SPECKLE; INTENSITY; ACCURACY
AB The clipping method is used to carry out the fast calculation of a correlation function of speckle intensity in several applications.  Using this technique, the peak position of the cross-correlation function can be determined more accurately than that for the nonclipped one.  There are several possible logical operations for calculating clipped speckle intensity.  Several methods of the logical operation of the intensity clipping are studied to evaluate the accuracy of the peak detection of the clipped correlation function.  Both the theoretical consideration and experimental results are given.

TI VACUUM POLARIZATION EFFECTS ON THE COULOMB SUM AT MOMENTUM-TRANSFER NEAR
   1 GEV
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS
LA English

ID QUASIELASTIC ELECTRON-SCATTERING; SIGMA-OMEGA-MODEL; RANDOM-PHASE
   APPROXIMATION; RESPONSE FUNCTIONS; CA-40; C-12; NUCLEI; FE-56
AB Particle-hole correlations including nucleon-antinucleon excitations reduce the Coulomb sum values of quasielastic scattering models by about 50% at momentum transfer near 1 GeV.  This result in a renormalized sigma-omega model is consistent with a recent experiment in SLAC.

TI NEW MECHANISM FOR THE VIBRATIONAL MODE-SPECIFIC PROTON-TRANSFER REACTION
   NH3+(UPSILON)+NH3-]NH2+NH4+
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID DYNAMIC PERTURBATION-THEORY; PHASE-SPACE THEORY; LIQUID WATER; POTENTIAL
   FUNCTIONS; MOLECULAR-DYNAMICS; ADDITIVE PROCEDURE; ENERGY-TRANSFER;
   ABINITIO; PREDISSOCIATION; SYSTEMS
AB A new mechanism has been presented for the vibrational mode-specific depression of the proton-transfer reaction NH3+ (upsilon) + NH3 --> NH2 + NH4+. We adopt the standpoint of the ADO (average dipole orientation) theory, proposed by Su and Bowers (J. Chem. Phys. 58 (1973) 3027), and append a new long-range interaction created by a vibration-induced dipole to the ADO theory. A "reaction zone" concept is crucial in this approach; outside of the zone the long-range intermolecular interactions play a key role. A qualitatively good agreement is observed for the experimental result of the title reaction obtained by Chupka and Russel (J. Chem. Phys. 48 (1968) 1527).
C1 KYOTO UNIV,DIV MOLEC ENGN,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.

TI DEPENDENCE OF GA DESORPTION RATE UPON THE STEP DENSITY IN MOLECULAR-BEAM
   EPITAXY OF GAAS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE GA DESORPTION; MOLECULAR BEAM EPITAXY; GAAS; STEP; EQUILIBRIUM; SINGLE
   QUANTUM WELL; SURFACE DIFFUSION
ID ENERGY ELECTRON-DIFFRACTION; GROWTH-RATES; SURFACES; SYSTEM
AB By using a single quantum well structure, the dependence of the Ga desorption rate upon the step density in the growth of GaAs by molecular beam epitaxy is studied.  It is shown that the desorption rate has no dependence in the entire range of the growth temperature within the sensitivity of the experiments.  By comparing the present theory with the experimental results, the upper limit of supersaturation possibly existing at the growth step is estimated and it is concluded that near equilibrium is established at the step edge at relatively high growth temperature where the evaporation of Ga occurs.
RP SUZUKI, T (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECT ENGN,7-3-1 HONGO,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI EFFECT OF ION VIBRATION FOR PROTON-TRANSFER REACTION OF AMMONIA CATION
SO JOURNAL OF CHEMICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID ADIABATIC CHANNEL MODEL; POLAR MOLECULE COLLISIONS; PHASE-SPACE THEORY;
   RATE CONSTANTS; UNIMOLECULAR PROCESSES; POLYATOMIC-MOLECULES; HITTING
   COLLISIONS; DIPOLAR MOLECULES; RATE COEFFICIENTS; CAPTURE
AB Ion vibration gives rise to a new pulsing dipole moment which effects the long-range interaction with the target molecule.  This pulsing long-range interaction mechanism has been applied to the proton-transfer reaction NH3+ (nu) + NH3 --> NH2 + NH4+ in which the vibrational mode-specific depression of the reaction rate is observed.  Significance of the vibrationally induced dipole moment of NH3+ (nu) has been clarified in such a way that the origin of the depression is ascribed to the interaction of this pulsing dipole moment with the permanent dipole moment of NH3.  The results of calculation agree qualitatively well with the experimental result [Chupka and Russell, J. Chem. Phys. 48, 1527 (1968)].

TI SURFACE PROCESSES OF H-2 IN THE INITIAL ACTIVATION OF LANI5
SO JOURNAL OF THE LESS-COMMON METALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON METAL-HYDROGEN SYSTEMS, FUNDAMENTALS AND
   APPLICATIONS
CY SEP 02-07, 1990
CL BANFF, CANADA
ID HYDROGEN ABSORPTION KINETICS; STORAGE MATERIALS; OXYGEN; OXIDE; FILMS;
   METALS; 300-K; LAYERS; PALLADIUM; TANTALUM
AB The surface processes of H-2 molecules in the initial activation of LaNi5 are demonstrated quantitatively by systematic measurements of the rate of H-2 absorption by LaNi5 with various surface conditions prepared in ultrahigh vacuum, low vacuum and air in the H-2 pressure range 10(-10) mbar-10(1) bar.  The reaction probability of H-2 with LaNi5 is reduced from 1 to 10(-3) at 298 K when the vacuum condition in the degassing treatment of LaNi5 is changed from 10(-10) to 10(-5) mbar.  The dissociation of H-2 molecules is markedly inhibited by the oxides and hydroxides of lanthanum and nickel which are formed during exposure of LaNi5 to low vacuum or air.  Increasing amounts of these surface layers reduce the reaction probability to 10(-6).  However, the kinetic data indicate that the dissociation of H-2 molecules can take place on lanthanum oxides.  The addition of a small quantity of nickel to lanthanum oxides markedly facilitates H-2 dissociation and subsequent hydrogen permeation through the lanthanum oxide layers.  The presence of suboxides such as LaOx, La2O3-x or La-NiOx in the surface region seems to be responsible for the ready activation of LaNi5 exposed to low vacuum or air.  The activation model proposed in this report does not require the presence of metallic nickel or nickel clusters in the surface region.
RP UCHIDA, H (reprint author), TOKAI UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL PHYS,HIRATSUKA,KANAGAWA 25912,JAPAN.

TI DOUBLE SINUSOIDAL PHASE-MODULATING LASER DIODE INTERFEROMETER FOR
   DISTANCE MEASUREMENT
SO APPLIED OPTICS
LA English
DT Article
ID FREQUENCY
AB Sinusoidal phase-modulating interferometry is used to detect exactly the sinusoidal phase variation of an interference signal even when the amplitude of the interference signal is varied by modulation of the injection current.  We can easily provide a sinusoidal phase-modulating interferometer with a feedback control system that eliminates the phase fluctuations caused by mechanical vibrations.  The methods using sinusoidal phase-modulating interferometry improve the resolution of distance measurements.  Experimental results show that the thickness of gauge blocks is measured with a resolution of approximately 0.5-mu-m.
RP SASAKI, O (reprint author), NIIGATA UNIV,FAC ENGN,8050 IKARASHI 2,NIIGATA 95021,JAPAN.

TI PHASE-LOCKED LASER DIODE INTERFEROMETER - HIGH-SPEED FEEDBACK-CONTROL
   SYSTEM
SO APPLIED OPTICS
LA English
DT Article
ID SURFACE PROFILE MEASUREMENT; MODULATING INTERFEROMETRY
AB We have previously proposed a phase-locked laser diode interferometer.  In that previous interferometer, however, there was substantial room for improvement in the reduction of measurement time.  This reduction is achieved by using a different process for generation of the feedback signal in which the output of a charge-coupled device image sensor is used effectively.  We analyze the feedback control system of the interferometer as a discrete-time system and discuss the characteristics of the interferometer.  It is shown that the measurement time is much shorter than that of the interferometer proposed previously.

TI EFFECT OF HYDROGENATION OF THE LEAKAGE CURRENTS OF LASER-ANNEALED
   POLYSILICON TFTS
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON ELECTRON DEVICES
LA English
DT Article
ID THIN-FILM TRANSISTORS; ELECTRICAL-PROPERTIES; SILICON
AB The effect of hydrogenation on the leakage currents of laser-annealed polysilicon TFT's was investigated for a low-temperature (< 600-degrees-C) process.  Before hydrogenation the laser-annealed TFT's gave larger leakage currents than those without laser annealing.  After hydrogenation, however, the leakage currents decreased significantly to values less than those without laser annealing.  Two groups of energy levels, deep and shallow, were suggested to account for the leakage current behavior.

TI SPECTRAL-DOMAIN ANALYSIS OF COPLANAR WAVE-GUIDE TRAVELING-WAVE
   ELECTRODES AND THEIR APPLICATIONS TO TI-LINBO3 MACH-ZEHNDER OPTICAL
   MODULATORS
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON MICROWAVE THEORY AND TECHNIQUES
LA English
DT Article
ID BANDWIDTH; GHZ
AB Hybrid-mode and quasi-TEM analyses are carried out for coplanar waveguide traveling-wave electrodes applicable to z-cut Ti:LiNbO3 optical modulators.  The analyses are based on the spectral-domain approach.  The microwave effective index and the characteristic impedance are clarified, together with the microwave conductor loss.  These are incorporated to accurately predict the modulator characteristics.  It is shown that these characteristics can be greatly improved by employing a thicker buffer layer.  High-speed and low-driving-power Ti:LiNbO3 optical modulators are realized at a 1.52-mu-m wavelength.  Agreement between the calculated and measured results is good.

TI IMPLEMENTATION AND EVALUATION OF AN IVDLAN TRANSMISSION-CIRCUIT
SO IEICE TRANSACTIONS ON COMMUNICATIONS ELECTRONICS INFORMATION AND SYSTEMS
LA English
DT Article
AB This paper presents experiments on a PR4 (Partial Response Class 4) transceiver aimed at using existing telephone-grade twisted pairs.  The achievable loop length for typical line codes is first estimated for a wide range of bit rates, assuming that near-end crosstalk (NEXT) is the crucial degrading factor on TTPs.  It is shown that a PR4 line code makes it possible to transmit 4 Mbps of data over a loop up to 450 meters long.  A low-cost transceiver adopting a newly developed timing extraction method, called LDT (Logically Decided Timing extraction), is implemented and evaluated.  It is experimentally confirmed that 4 Mbps transmission over existing TTPs was achieved in the presence of crosstalk and impulse noise.
RP MIYAMOTO, T (reprint author), HITACHI LTD,CENT RES LAB,KOKUBUNJI,TOKYO 185,JAPAN.

TI CORROSION OF A TYPE-304 STAINLESS-STEEL AND A MOLYBDENUM-BASE TZM ALLOY
   IN REFLUXING MERCURY WITH A SMALL AMOUNT OF POTASSIUM
SO JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article
AB Corrosion of a Type 304 stainless steel and a molybdenum-base TZM alloy (Mo-0.5Ti-0.08Zr-0.025C-0.025 oxygen) in refluxing mercury with and without about 0.004 mol fraction of potassium in mercury has been examined using small capsules made of the steel and the alloy at 600 and 700-degrees-C to recognize the corrosion mechanisms.  The wall of the austenitic 304 stainless steel capsule was severely corroded due to selective dissolution of nickel and chromium, leading to a ferritic layer which is more stable than the austenitic phase.  The corrosion products were deposited near the vapor-liquid interface of the mercury.  In contrast, the TZM alloy showed no noticeable changes except for carburization of the surface after heating for 2000 h, probably due to the low solubility of molybdenum in mercury.

TI 2-STEP SUPERCONDUCTING TRANSITION AND ANOMALOUS PRESSURE-DEPENDENCE OF
   TC IN LA2CUO4
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID LA2CUXO4-Y
AB Anomalous pressure dependences of the resistance and the superconducting transition temperature T(c) have been observed in La2CuO4 to 17 kbar.  With pressure, T(c) first decreases, then takes a minimum at 3 kbar and finally increases at a rate of 0.5 K/kbar.  The Neel temperature T(N) decreases with pressure.  Some likely origins are briefly discussed for a two-step superconducting transition and negative/positive dT(c)/dP.

TI A REALISTIC SPECTRAL-FUNCTION OF HE-4
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID ELASTIC ELECTRON-SCATTERING; ALPHA-PARTICLE
AB Spectral function of He-4 is calculated based on the realistic ground-state wave function within the plane wave approximation for final nucleon system.  Effect of nucleon-nucleon correlation is studied and is shown to dominate the spectral function at high removal energies and momenta.  An improved spectral function is obtained which almost satisfies the momentum sum rule.  It is shown that the four-body breakup channel gives a dominant contribution to the sum rule at high momentum region.

TI PROTONATION EQUILIBRIA OF NITRILOTRIS(METHYLENEPHOSPHONATO)- AND
   ETHYLENEDIAMINETETRAKIS(METHYLENEPHOSPHONATO)-COMPLEXES OF SCANDIUM,
   YTTRIUM, AND LANTHANOIDS
SO JOURNAL OF SOLUTION CHEMISTRY
LA English
DT Article
DE PROTONATION OF METAL COMPLEX; AMINOPOLYPHOSPHONATE COMPLEXES;
   SCANDIUM-NTMP, YTTRIUM-NTMP, AND LANTHANOID-NTMP COMPLEXES;
   SCANDIUM-EDTMP YTTRIUM-EDTMP AND LANTHANOID-EDTMP COMPLEXES
ID TRANSITION-METAL IONS; AQUEOUS-SOLUTION; AMINO POLYPHOSPHONATES;
   COMPLEX-FORMATION; ACID
AB The protonation equilibria of nitrilotris(methylenephosphonic acid) (NTMP, H6L) and ethylenediaminetetrakis(methylenephosphonic acid) (EDTMP, H8L) complexes of scandium, yttrium, and lanthanoids have been studied potentiometrically at 25-degrees-C and at an ionic strength of 0.1 mol-dm-3 KNO3.  The first protonation constants of NTMP complexes of lanthanoids, K(MHL), decrease with decreasing of the ionic radius of the lanthanoid [log K(MHL) = 7.82 (La3+) - 6.90 (Lu3+)] and show a so-called "Tetrad effect."  The second protonation constants, K(MH2L), change very little with the lanthanoid metal ions (log K(MH2L) = 5.3 - 5.7).  These results suggest that, in the first protonation process in ML, the proton attacks the nitrogen of NTMP rupturing the M-N of M(ntmp)3-.  The pattern of the change in the protonation constants of the EDTMP complexes with the atomic number of the lanthanoid is quite different from that of the NTMP complexes.  This fact indicates that the manner of protonation of the EDTMP complexes differs from that of NTMP complexes.  The protonation constants of yttrium complexes of NTMP and EDTMP agree with those of lanthanoid complexes, whereas those of scandium complexes deviate from the values predicted from its ionic radius.
C1 NIIGATA UNIV,FAC EDUC,DEPT CHEM,NIIGATA 95021,JAPAN.
   NIIGATA UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,NIIGATA 95021,JAPAN.
CR ARTELL AE, 1982, STABILITY CONSTANTS, V5
   KABACHNI.MI, 1967, DOKL AKAD NAUK SSSR+, V175, P351
   MOTEKAITIS RJ, 1976, INORG CHEM, V15, P2303, DOI 10.1021/ic50163a066
   MOTEKAIT.RJ, 1971, INORG NUCL CHEM LETT, V7, P1103, DOI 10.1016/0020-1650(71)80101-0
   NAKASUKA N, 1985, INORG CHEM, V24, P10, DOI 10.1021/ic00195a005
   PEPPARD DF, 1970, J INORG NUCL CHEM, V32, P339, DOI 10.1016/0022-1902(70)80478-X
   PEPPARD DF, 1969, J INORG NUCL CHEM, V31, P2271, DOI 10.1016/0022-1902(69)90044-X

TI ATTEMPTS IN DETECTION OF NEUTRONS ON SO-CALLED COLD NUCLEAR-FUSION
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
AB Neutron emissions from electrolysis of D2O with palladium and palladium-titanium electrodes as well as from pressurized D2 gas with titanium alloys have been measured.  The neutron detector system was so designed to have very low background condition.  Neutron-gamma separation technique using liquid scintillator was applied to obtain essentially no gamma ray background condition for neutron counting.  No significant signal of neutron emission was observed.  Upper limits of emission probability of neutron have been determined to be 6 x 10(-3) s-1, 1 x 10(-2) s-1, and 2.3 x 10(-2) s-1 for Pd electrode, Pd-Ti electrode, and pressurized gas systems.  These values are orders of magnitude lower than that presented by Jones paper (0.4 s-1).
RP KUMAGAI, H (reprint author), INST PHYS & CHEM RES,2-1 HIROSAWA,WAKO,SAITAMA 35101,JAPAN.

TI HYBRID CORRELATOR FOR CLIPPED SPECKLE INTENSITY USING LCD
SO OPTICS COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
AB An optical and electrical hybrid correlator is proposed to calculate clipped speckle intensity signals. The counter and memory circuits in the conventional one-bit correlator (clipping correlator) can be replaced by the combination of a liquid crystal device (LCD), a cylindrical lens, and a PCD detector. We demonstrate the principal experimental system's operation and obtain the correlation signals.

TI HYDROGENATION OF CARBON-DIOXIDE OVER IRON-OXIDE CATALYST
SO REACTION KINETICS AND CATALYSIS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID METALS; HYDROCARBONS; CO2
AB Hydrogenation of carbon dioxide was carried out over reduced Fe3O4 catalyst.  Effect of reduction temperature of the catalyst, reaction temperature, space velocity, and component of feed gas were examined on the catalyst.  From various experiments, the proper conditions for the hydrogenation of carbon dioxide are proposed.  In addition, oxidation of the catalyst took place simultaneously during the hydrogenation of CO2.

TI STUDY ON MODELING AND ITS PARAMETER-ESTIMATION OF A MULTIBLADED WINDMILL
SO INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF ENERGY RESEARCH
LA English
DT Article
DE MULTIBLADED WINDMILL; MODELING; ESTIMATION; TORQUE LOSS COEFFICIENT
AB The paper presents a modelling technique and a method for determination of the windmill torque loss coefficients of a multibladed windmill.  First, a new model is presented of a multibladed windmill, and the windmill torque loss coefficients are defined.  Next, a measuring method based on a recursive estimation technique is developed for determination of the values of these coefficients.  The torque loss coefficients are estimated satisfactorily from the simulated data and experimental data for changes in wind speed.  The validity of the windmill model and the proposed estimating technique are demonstrated.

TI MICROSTRUCTURAL CHARACTERIZATION OF NB3AL ULTRAFINE MULTIFILAMENTARY
   SUPERCONDUCTING WIRE BY ANALYTICAL ELECTRON-MICROSCOPY
SO APPLIED PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID NB-AL; METALLURGY
AB Microstructural characterization of the longitudinal cross section of Nb3Al wires fabricated by an Nb tube composite process is presented. The wire was produced by cold reduction and a subsequent reaction between Nb matrix and Al-Mg core (final size: approximately phi-80 nm) at 950-degrees-C x 5 min + 750-degrees-C X 72 h. The A15 superconducting compound (grain size: 100 nm) and unreacted fibrous Nb were observed in the microstructure. Nb2Al or other phases rarely appeared. The average Al concentration at the A15 grain was 22-23 at. % from x-ray microanalysis. The critical current density J(c) of composite processed wire depended on the grain size of A15, with fine grains providing a high J(c) value.
C1 HITACHI CABLE LTD,MET RES LAB,TSUCHIURA,IBARAKI 300,JAPAN.

TI REACTION CHARACTERISTICS OF HYDROXYAPATITE WITH F- AND PO3F2- IONS -
   CHEMICAL-STATES OF FLUORINE IN HYDROXYAPATITE
SO JOURNAL OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY-FARADAY TRANSACTIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID DENTAL ENAMEL; MONOFLUOROPHOSPHATE; DENTIFRICES; REMINERALIZATION;
   APATITE; SALIVA; NAF
AB The reactions of F- and PO3F2- ions with hydroxyapatite (HAP) are of interest owing to their dental application.  The mechanism of the anti-caries effect of the fluorides, however, is still not clearly understood.  In the present study the reaction characteristics of HAP with sodium fluoride (NaF) and sodium monofluorophosphate (Na2PO3F) in aqueous solutions have been investigated using various techniques.  F- ions were more easily taken up by HAP than were PO3F2- ions, but no significant change in the X-ray diffraction pattern was observed, though CaF2 was formed only in acidic solutions.  X-Ray photoelectron spectroscopy studies have shown that F- ions were ion-exchanged for structural OH- ions of HAP to produce fluorapatite in neutral solution at an F- concentration of 1000-10000 ppm, and that PO3F2- ions were chemisorbed onto the HAP surface or ion-exchanged for HPO4(2-) ions.  The PO3F2- ions were then partially hydrolysed to free F- and orthophosphate ions, and this was followed by incorporation of F- into HAP.  Na+ ions were not incorporated into HAP in contrast to the divalent cations such as Sn2+ and Zn2+ ions reported previously.
C1 YAMANASHI UNIV,DEPT APPL CHEM & BIOL TECHNOL,KOFU,YAMANASHI 400,JAPAN.

TI A NEW LIMIT ON THE FLUX OF STRANGE MATTER
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID PLASTIC TRACK DETECTORS; MAGNETIC MONOPOLES; COSMIC NUCLEARITES;
   MOUNTAIN ALTITUDE; SEARCH; PARTICLES; PHASES; SYSTEM; LEVEL
AB A search has been made for strange matter with a CR-39 track-etch detector with an array of 160 m2, exposed for 8 months at mountain altitude.  The non-observation of penetrating tracks places a new stringent upper limit on the flux of strange matter, 2.2 x 10(-14) cm-2s-1sr-1 (90% confidence level) in the velocity range-beta (= v/c) > 4 x 10(-5).

TI THIN-FILM COLD-CATHODE USING ZNS LAYER
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE COLD CATHODE; THIN FILM; ELECTRON; HIGH FIELD; ELECTRON EMISSION;
   ELECTRODE; INSULATOR; ZNS; AU; TA2O5; ITO
AB A new thin-film cold cathode (TFCC), which is composed of a Sn-doped In2O3/Ta2O5/ZnS/Au, has been investigated.  The TFCC, which is different from the cold cathodes reported so far, causes electron emissions by electrons flowing across the ZnS layer by a high ac-field.  An average emission current of 28 nA/cm2 has been obtained.  To demonstrate the electron emission from the TFCC, cathodeluminescence from phosphor coated on an anode has been observed.  The mechanism of the TFCC is also discussed.

TI SURFACE FRACTAL DIMENSIONAL CHANGE OF MICROPOROUS CARBON-FIBERS WITH
   PARTIAL GRAPHITIZATION
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID MICROGRAPHITIC CARBONS; PHYSICAL ADSORPTION; MOLECULES; N-2
AB The surface fractal dimension D(a) of the micropore walls of activated carbon fibers (ACFs) preheated at 1573 and 1773 K in an Ar atmosphere was determined by precision organic-vapor adsorption measurements. Preheating of ACF caused partial graphitization as demonstrated by X-ray diffraction examination. The D(a) values of the original cellulose-based ACF and nonporous carbon black were 2.9 and 2.0, respectively. The D(a) of ACF heated at 1773 K decreased to 2.3, indicating that the micropore wall becomes flatter and approaches a graphitic surface.

TI FABRICATION OF A POLY-SI THIN-FILM TRANSISTOR WITH STORAGE CAPACITOR
SO DISPLAYS
LA English
DT Article
DE LIQUID-CRYSTAL DISPLAY; STORAGE CAPACITOR; ITO
ID OXIDE
AB The fabrication process of a low-temperature poly-Si thin-film transistor (TFT) with a storage capacitor was studied. The atmospheric-pressure chemical-vapour deposited SiO2 protected the buried indium tin oxide (ITO) from reduction by a pure H-2 plasma treatment that was essential for the effective improvement of the poly-Si TFT characteristics. Thus, a storage capacitor with an ITO (picture electrode)-SiO2-ITO (buried common electrode) structure was successfully fabricated. The poly-Si TFT with a channel width/length W/L ratio of 5 drove a 3 pF storage capacitor in 2-mu-s, and it showed superior driverability for LCD use. The TFT also had good hold characteristics under illumination for the realization of grey-scale representation.
RP MIMURA, A (reprint author), HITACHI LTD,HITACHI RES LAB,4026 KUJI CHO,HITACHI,IBARAKI 31912,JAPAN.

TI 3-DIMENSIONAL ANTIFERROMAGNETIC ORDER AND ANISOTROPIC
   MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES IN BI2CUO4
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE NEUTRON DIFFRACTION; ANTIFERROMAGNETISM; BI2CUO4; COPPER OXIDE
ID CUBI2O4
AB The structure and magnetic properties of Bi2CuO4 have been studied by neutron and X-ray diffraction, magnetic susceptibility and magnetization measurements.  Three-dimensional (3D) and anisotropic antiferromagnetism is revealed for this compound rather than the previously anticipated one-dimensional one.  Long-range antiferromagnetic order associated with a ferromagnetic stacking of Cu2+ spins along the [001] axis starts to develop below T(N) = 42 K.  A magnetic moment of 0.85 +/- 0.05-mu-B/Cu which is larger than those of Cu2+ spins in the two-dimensional Heisenberg antiferromagnets such as La2CuO4 and Sr2CuCl2O2 reflects the 3D character in Bi2CuO4.  A non-linear magnetization curve under an inplane magnetic field is analyzed quantitatively by a continuous spin rotation in the (001) plane.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,DEPT MAT RES,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
   NATL INST RES INORGAN MAT,SAKURA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI PREDICTION METHOD FOR THE SITE OCCUPATION OF 3RD ELEMENT IN TIAL PHASE
SO MATERIALS TRANSACTIONS JIM
LA English
DT Article
DE INTERMETALLIC COMPOUND; TITANIUM ALUMINIDE; TIAL PHASE; OCCUPATION SITE;
   ADDITIVE ELEMENT; X-RAY ANALYSIS; SUBSTITUTION BEHAVIOR; LATTICE
   SPACING; L10-TYPE CRYSTAL
ID SYSTEM
AB Two prediction methods for the site occupation of the third elements in L1(0)-type TiAl alloys have been proposed.  One was derived from the empirical rule where the change of lattice parameters, a and c, of the TiAl phase with the addition of third elements is taken account of.  Here, the parameters a and c satisfied the following two conditions.  (1) The axial ratio, c/a, decreases with increasing the atom diameter ratio, D-alpha/D-beta.  Here, D-alpha or D-beta is the average diameter of atom which occupies the alpha- or beta-sublattice in the L1(0)-type crystal lattice.  (2) The ratio of D-alpha/D-beta and the value of (D-alpha-(a/square-root 2))/D-beta converge into a narrow range.  The other was obtained from the interaction parameters of the constituent atoms in the TiAl phase.  In addition, the amount of site occupation of the third elements, Ag, Fe, Ga, Ni and Pt, and that of host elements in the TiAl phase were determined by an X-ray analysis.  The occupation amounts of the additives predicted by the former method agreed well with those determined by X-ray analysis.
C1 TOKYO INST TECHNOL,FAC ENGN,DEPT MET,MEGURO,TOKYO 154,JAPAN.
RP HASHIMOTO, K (reprint author), NATL RES INST MET,MEGURO KU,TOKYO 153,JAPAN.

TI SELECTIVE CONVERSION OF ETHANE INTO ACETALDEHYDE BY PHOTO-CATALYTIC
   OXIDATION WITH OXYGEN OVER A SUPPORTED MOLYBDENUM CATALYST
SO APPLIED CATALYSIS
LA English
DT Article
DE ETHANE CONVERSION; MOLYBDENUM SILICA; PHOTOCATALYSIS; SELECTIVITY
   (ACETALDEHYDE)
ID METHANE
AB The selective photo-oxidation of ethane with oxygen is achieved using MoO3/SiO2 catalyst above 463 K. At 493 K, acetaldehyde is formed in the yield of 60-mu-mol/h along with 22-mu-mol/h of formaldehyde combined with the selectivity for aldehydes over 90%.

TI ULTRAMICROPORES IN MICROPOROUS CARBON-FIBERS EVIDENCED BY HELIUM
   ADSORPTION AT 4.2 K
SO JOURNAL OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY-FARADAY TRANSACTIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID HE-4
AB The adsorption isotherms of He on activated carbon fibres at 4.2 k have been determined gravimetrically.  The He adsorption isotherms were of typical type I and were analysed by the Dubinin-Radushkevich plots, giving the micropore volumes which are greater than those obtained from the N2 adsorption isotherm at 77 k by 20-50%.  The excess amount of He adsorption was ascribed to the presence of ultramicropores which cannot be assessed by N2 molecules.

TI INTERNAL COORDINATE APPROACH FOR THE VIBRATIONAL PREDISSOCIATION OF
   (NO)2
SO THEOCHEM-JOURNAL OF MOLECULAR STRUCTURE
LA English
DT Article
ID DYNAMIC PERTURBATION-THEORY; INFRARED PHOTODISSOCIATION;
   ENERGY-TRANSFER; RELAXATION; MOLECULES; COMPLEXES; ABINITIO; SYSTEMS;
   STATE; N2O2
AB An internal coordinate approach for four-body nonrigid molecular dynamics is presented and applied to the vibrational predissociation (VP) or (NO)2.  The linewidths and lifetimes of the VP process are calculated using a perturbation theory, and found to be in good agreement with experimental results.  The significance of the momentum coupling between the NO bond and the NN bond is clarified.  The dynamic perturbation based on the momentum coupling compensates with the conventional potential perturbation, serving as a candidate for an understanding of the small isotope effect observed by Matsumoto, Ohshima and Takami, J. Chem. Phys., 92 (1990) 937.
C1 FAC ENGN KYOTO,DIV MOLEC ENGN,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.
   INST FUNDAMENTAL CHEM,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.

TI SYNTHESIS AND CHARACTERIZATION OF NOVEL PARA-TERPHENOQUINONE ANALOGS
   INVOLVING A CENTRAL DIHYDROTHIOPHENEDIYLIDENE STRUCTURE
SO JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY
LA English
DT Article
ID CROSS-CONJUGATED HYDROCARBONS; PARA-QUINONOID RING; CHARGE-TRANSFER
   COMPLEX; ELECTROCONDUCTIVE COMPLEXES; ELECTRON AFFINITIES;
   PARA-BENZOQUINONES; REDUCTION; ACCEPTORS; OXIDATION; CHEMISTRY
AB The title quinones, 2,5-bis(4-oxo-2,5-cyclohexadien-1-ylidene)-2,5-dihydrothiophene and its tetraalkyl derivatives, were synthesized via 2-(4-alkoxyphenyl)thiophene and 2,5-bis(4-alkoxyphenyl)thiophene conveniently prepared by using palladium(0)-catalyzed cross coupling reaction of 4-alkoxyaryl halides and thienylzinc chloride. The ground-state structures and redox properties of these quinones were fully characterized based on spectroscopic data (IR, H-1 NMR, C-13 NMR, UV-vis, and MS), X-ray analysis, cyclic voltammetry, CNDO/2 calculation, and EPR spectroscopic investigation. These quinones show an intense absorption maximum in the region of 531-558 nm of their electronic spectra. Despite their three-ring system, these quinones exist in a coplanar conformation in the solid state in which the terminal six-membered rings incline 9.1-degrees and 11.1-degrees, respectively, from the central five-membered ring, and the twisting angle between the mean planes of the two terminal rings is 1.8-degrees. Rotation about the intercyclic bonds does not take place at ordinary temperatures in solution. Noticeably, these quinones exhibit a half-wave oxidation potential (E1ox value) of 1.26-1.46 V along with half-wave reduction potentials (E1red value) of -0.11 to -0.52 V and (E2red value) of -0.20 to -0.67 V vs SCE, so that they have been proven to be a new type of quinones exhibiting an amphoteric redox property undergoing two-stage one-electron reduction up to the dianions and one-electron oxidation up to the radical cations. The reduction and oxidation potentials of these quinones are in good correspondence with the calculated energy levels of the HOMO and the LUMO. Decrease in the HOMO-LUMO gap is mainly ascribed to the destabilized HOMO lying at a higher level by 0.97 eV than that of diphenoquinone. Both the cation and anion radicals were generated by the electrochemical reduction and oxidation of these amphoteric quinones and have been definitely characterized by EPR spectroscopy.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,CHEM RES INST NONAQUEOUS SOLUT,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
   HIROSHIMA UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,HIROSHIMA 730,JAPAN.

TI THE STRUCTURE OF NOTORYNE, A HALOGENATED C15 NONTERPENOID WITH A NOVEL
   CARBON SKELETON FROM THE RED ALGA LAURENCIA-NIPPONICA YAMADA
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID MARINE PLANTS; BROMO ETHER; C-15 ACETYLENES; CONSTITUENTS; OKAMURAI;
   DEACETYLKUMAUSYNES; NEOLAURENCENYNE; LACTOPEROXIDASE; LAUREEPOXIDE;
   KUMAUSYNES
AB A new halogenated C15 nonterpenoid with a novel carbon framework, named notoryne, has been isolated from the title alga and its structure was established on the basis of spectroscopic and chemical evidence.  In addition, the structure of a rearranged product, whose structure has long remained unsettled, of laurefucin derivative was also determined by spectral and chemical methods.  Furthermore, the biogenesis of the halogenated C15 nonterpenoids from L. nipponica collected at warm current region in Hokkaido is also discussed.

TI OVER 10 GB/S REGENERATORS USING MONOLITHIC ICS FOR LIGHTWAVE
   COMMUNICATION-SYSTEMS
SO IEEE JOURNAL ON SELECTED AREAS IN COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID ALIGNED PROCESS TECHNOLOGY; DOPED FIBER AMPLIFIERS; TRANSMISSION-SYSTEM;
   GAAS-MESFETS; BANDWIDTH; GBIT/S; CIRCUIT
AB We have designed and fabricated multigigabit/second repeater circuits using both Si and GaAs processes.  The Si IC's operated up to 9 Gb/s, and the GaAs IC's exceeded 10 Gb/s.  Their stable operation was verified in a 10 Gb/s long-distance transmission experiment.  The performance of the 10 Gb/s repeater using these monolithic IC's and photonic circuits is discussed.

TI TRAJECTORY CONTROL OF ROBOTIC MANIPULATORS USING NEURAL NETWORKS
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON INDUSTRIAL ELECTRONICS
LA English
DT Article
AB This paper presents a nonlinear compensator using neural networks for trajectory control of robotic manipulators.  The adaptive capability of the neural network controller to compensate unstructured uncertainties is clarified.  A model learning scheme is also proposed in this paper.  The learning procedure is effective and efficient in learning the manipulator dynamics, and error convergence with untrained trajectories is fast.

TI A DIAGRAMMATIC UNITARITY AND A FEYNMAN-LIKE RULE FOR THE
   OPEN-BOSONIC-STRING AMPLITUDES
SO NUOVO CIMENTO DELLA SOCIETA ITALIANA DI FISICA A-NUCLEI PARTICLES AND
   FIELDS
LA English
DT Article
ID FORMALISM; OPERATOR
AB A diagrammatic unitarity of the open bosonic string amplitudes is investigated by using the symmetric N-point vertices and the unified propagator in the BRST-invariant operator formalism. It is shown that general amplitudes satisfying the unitarity are realized in the sum of all loop amplitudes with an equal weight up to the coupling constant of the 3-string vertex. The Feynman-like rule for the open-bosonic-string theory is also presented.
RP KOBAYASHI, T (reprint author), UNIV TSUKUBA, INST PHYS, SAKURA, IBARAKI 305, JAPAN.

TI MEASUREMENT OF CROSS-SECTIONS AND OSCILLATOR-STRENGTHS FOR XE BY
   ELECTRON-IMPACT
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW A
LA English
DT Article
ID ELASTIC-SCATTERING; RARE-GASES; EXCITATION; SPECTROSCOPY; TRANSITIONS;
   XENON; ATOMS; KR
AB Differential cross sections and generalized oscillator strengths have been measured for two optically allowed transitions 5p6(1S0)-->5p5(2P1/2)6s and 5p5(2P3/2)6s in Xe by means of electron-energy-loss spectroscopy.  These measurements are carried out for electron kinetic energies of 100, 400, and 500 eV at small scattering angles (theta = 1.4-degrees-14.6-degrees).  The generalized oscillator strengths are extrapolated to zero momentum transfer to get the optical oscillator strengths and they are compared with those obtained by optical methods and theoretical calculations.  The optical oscillator strengths obtained by this work for the 5p5(2P1/2)6s and 5p5(2P3/2)6s states are 0.158 +/- 0.019 and 0.222 +/- 0.027, respectively.  Integral cross sections have been also determined for each impact energy.  The errors are estimated to be less than 12%.

TI CALORIMETRIC STANDARDS FOR PHOTOTHERMAL METHODS IN ULTRAVIOLET AND
   VISIBLE SPECTRAL REGIONS
SO RESEARCH ON CHEMICAL INTERMEDIATES
LA English
DT Article
AB Utilizing a time-resolved thermal lensing (TRTL) technique coupled with laser flash excitation, we have determined the heat conversion efficiency, alpha, of photoexcited molecules in solution at room temperature.  The efficiencies of pyridazine, dicumarol, and 8-quinolinol are unity in the ultraviolet region.  Azulene is demonstrated to be a good calorimetric standard in the visible region.  The solvent effect on the thermal lens signal is well explained by thermal properties of solvent molecules, i.e. the cubic expansion coefficient and the specific heat capacity.

TI SYNERGISTIC STIMULATORY EFFECT OF GLUCOCORTICOID, EGF AND INSULIN ON THE
   SYNTHESIS OF RIBOSOMAL-RNA AND PHOSPHORYLATION OF NUCLEOLIN IN PRIMARY
   CULTURED RAT HEPATOCYTES
SO BIOCHIMICA ET BIOPHYSICA ACTA
LA English
DT Article
DE RIBOSOMAL-RNA; NUCLEOLIN; PRIMARY CULTURED HEPATOCYTE; GLUCOCORTICOID;
   EGF; INSULIN
ID CASEIN KINASE-II; EPIDERMAL GROWTH-FACTOR; PROTEIN-KINASE; POLYMERASE-I;
   ALPHA-1-ACID GLYCOPROTEIN; THYROID-HORMONE; LIVER NUCLEOLI;
   MESSENGER-RNA; CELLS; INVIVO
AB Effects of dexamethasone, EGF and insulin on the synthesis of rRNA and phosphorylation of nucleolin in primary cultures of adult rat hepatocytes were studied. Hepatocytes were incubated for 8 h with EGF (20 ng/ml) plus insulin (0.1-mu-M) and/or for 20 h with dexamethasone (1-mu-M) before the end of incubation. The incorporation of [H-3]uridine into acid-insoluble materials and the nuclear activity of RNA polymerase I were stimulated approx. 2-fold with EGF plus insulin and these were further enhanced 2-3-times by dexamethasone, although dexamethasone alone exerted no stimulation. When hepatocytes were incubated with [P-32]orthophosphate, similar enhancement by these hormones was also observed in the phosphorylation of a nucleolar protein, nucleolin, which was detected by immunoprecipitation with anti-nucleolin antibodies. The amount of nucleolin was slightly increased by EGF plus insulin in the presence of dexamethasone, but scarcely changed by treatment with EGF plus insulin or dexamethasone alone. Cycloheximide inhibited RNA synthesis to a greater or lesser degree in the case of all hepatocytes which were cultured with or without these hormonal treatments. These results indicate that the in vivo effect of glucocorticoid on rRNA synthesis and nucleolin phosphorylation in liver is primarily a direct action on parenchymal cells and requires other growth factors such as EGF and insulin.
