TI INFRARED DIODE-LASER STUDY OF THE 248 NM PHOTODISSOCIATION OF CH3I
SO JOURNAL OF CHEMICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID FLIGHT MASS-SPECTROMETRY; EMISSION-SPECTROSCOPY; METHYL-IODIDE; UMBRELLA
   MODE; PHOTOFRAGMENTATION DYNAMICS; ABSORPTION-SPECTROSCOPY;
   PHOTO-DISSOCIATION; 266 NM; EXCITATION; BAND
AB The vibrational distribution of CH3 radicals produced by the 248 nm photodissociation of CH3I has been investigated by infrared diode laser kinetic spectroscopy.  The v2 bands of CH3, v2 = 1<--0 up to 4<--3, were observed as functions of time for the sample pressure ranging from 9 to 100 mTorr.  The observed Doppler line shape showed a clear correlation between the transition dipole moment and the recoil velocity (mu - v) in the photodissociation, and the observed linewidth indicated that CH3 fragments were predominantly generated through the I(2P1/2) adiabatic dissociation channel.  The relative population in each vibrational level was determined to be 0.66:0.26:0.08:0.004 for v = 0, 1, 2, and 3, in sharp contrast to the inverted vibrational distribution reported previously.  The present result suggests that the geometry of the CH3 moiety in the precursor CH3I is relaxed gradually to its equilibrium planar structure before the cleavage of C-I bond takes place.

TI ORGANIC METALS OF BIS(ETHYLENEDIOXY)TETRATHIAFUL-VALENE (BEDT-TTF)
SO SYNTHETIC METALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY OF SYNTHETIC METALS ( ICSM
   90 )
CY SEP 02-07, 1990
CL TUBINGEN, FED REP GER
ID 1ST
AB The experimental details of the preparation of the title compound is described.  The physical properties of (BEDO-TTF)2.4I3 are presented.  The temperature dependence of the conductivity, the spin paramagnetism, the EPR linewidth and the thermoelectric power indicate that the iodide salt is a molecular metal with a 300-1.2K resistance ratio of 275 in the stacking axis direction, and devoid of perceptible phase transitions in the same temperature range.

TI TRANSMISSION ELECTRON-MICROSCOPY CHARACTERIZATION OF THE INITIAL-STAGE
   OF EPITAXIAL-GROWTH OF GAP ON SI BY LOW-PRESSURE METALORGANIC CHEMICAL
   VAPOR-DEPOSITION
SO APPLIED PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID ASH3 PREFLOW
AB The initial stage of epitaxial growth of GaP on Si by low-pressure metalorganic chemical vapor deposition was characterized by transmission electron microscopy.  The growth mode changes from three-dimensional to two-dimensional with increasing V/III ratio.  GaP on Si grown at a low V/III ratio of 800 contains many dislocations, stacking faults, and microtwins; however, a significant reduction in the density of these defects is observed in GaP grown at high V/III ratio of 3200.
C1 UNIV CALIF BERKELEY,DEPT MAT SCI,BERKELEY,CA 94720.

TI REACTIVE PROPERTIES OF THE ORGANIC SOLVENT-SOLUBLE LIPASE
SO BIOCHIMICA ET BIOPHYSICA ACTA
LA English
DT Article
DE LIPASE; ORGANIC SOLVENT-SOLUBLE LIPASE; THERMOSTABILITY; ENZYMATIC
   REACTIVITY; DETERGENT
ID PSEUDOMONAS-FRAGI 22.39-B; PURIFICATION; LIPOPROTEIN; SEQUENCE
AB In a previous report, the organic solvent-soluble lipase was prepared using a synthetic detergent, didodecyl glucosyl glutamate, and it was estimated that 150 +/- 30 molecules of the detergent were attached to one lipase molecule based on gel permeation chromatography and chemical analysis.  In this paper, the reactivity of the organic solvent-soluble lipase was compared with that of the native lipase to study the effect of the surrounding detergent on the thermostability and enzymatic reactivity.  The activity of the organic solvent-soluble lipase was preserved in the organic solvents up to a temperature of 50-degrees-C as in the case of the native lipase in buffer (pH 7.0).  The influence of the chain length of fatty acids of the substrate triacylglycerols on the hydrolysis activities was studied.  The organic solvent-soluble lipase hydrolyzed triacylglycerols with longer chains more rapidly than the native lipase.  The presence of Ca2+ at 0.1 mM stimulated the activity of the native lipase, whereas Ca2+ at a high concentration inhibited it.  On the other hand, even at a low concentration, Ca2+ inhibited the activity of the organic solvent-soluble lipase.  These results suggest that the detergent attached to the lipase molecule affected the reactive properties.
RP TSUZUKI, W (reprint author), MAFF,NATL FOOD RES INST,KANNONDAI 2-1-2,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI MECHANISM OF PHOTOCONDUCTION ON SURFACE-OXIDIZED GE FILMS
SO APPLIED SURFACE SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SOLID FILMS AND SURFACES
CY AUG 13-17, 1990
CL PROVIDENCE, RI
SP RHODE ISLAND CTR THIN FILM & INTERFACE RES & IND PARTNERSHIP, STATE RHODE ISLAND, DEPT ECON DEV, TECHNOL COUNCIL RHODE ISLAND
HO BROWN UNIV
ID UV-LIGHT; TE
AB We have investigated photoconduction on surface-oxidized Ge films and proposed a photo-dissociation model in the previous paper.  The photocurrent I(p) rises at 2.5 eV, increases linearly with photon energy up to 3.4 eV, becomes flat and then begins to decrease for energies > 4.0 eV.  To study this behavior further, we performed experiments using double beams and analysed the results within the framework of a proposed photo-dissociation model based on the assumption of both reactions (I) O2- + e- --> 2O- and (II) O2- --> O + O-.  However, the results could not be explained without taking the third reaction 2O- + (O + O-) --> 2O2- + e- into into account.
C1 CHIBA UNIV,FAC EDUC,CHIBA 260,JAPAN.

TI A 1/2-IN CCD IMAGER WITH LATERAL OVERFLOW-GATE SHUTTER
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON ELECTRON DEVICES
LA English
DT Article
AB The design considerations and performance of an Inter-Line transfer CCD (IL-CCD) imager with a lateral overflow gate are described.  A 489 (V) x 670 (H) pixel 1/2-in.  IL-CCD imager is shown to have a variable shutter function, whose shutter speed is controlled successively from 1/60 to 1/15 700 s by the timing of the overflow gate pulse.  The device requires a low voltage of only 4 V and a simple overflow gate pulse to realize the shutter function without any undesirable die size enlargement.

TI SURFACE-DIFFUSION OF AL AND GA ATOMS ON GAAS (001) AND (111)B VICINAL
   SURFACES IN MOLECULAR-BEAM EPITAXY
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MOLECULAR BEAM EPITAXY
CY AUG 27-31, 1990
CL LA JOLLA, CA
HO UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO
ID MBE GROWTH; SUPERLATTICE
AB We have measured the critical temperature where the growth mode transition between step-flow and 2D nucleation takes place by RHEED measurements during the molecular beam epitaxial growth of GaAs and AlAs on (001) and (111)B GaAs vicinal surfaces.  Combining the experimental results with our theory and taking into account the surface diffusion and supersaturation ratio of adatoms on the terraces, the intrinsic surface diffusion length lambda-s of Al and Ga atoms is estimated on both (001) and (111)B GaAs vicinal surfaces with various misorientation directions.

TI SURFACE-DIFFUSION AND ATOM INCORPORATION KINETICS IN MBE OF INGAAS AND
   ALGAAS
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MOLECULAR BEAM EPITAXY
CY AUG 27-31, 1990
CL LA JOLLA, CA
HO UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO
ID MOLECULAR-BEAM EPITAXY; ENERGY ELECTRON-DIFFRACTION; GROWTH; GAAS(001);
   GAAS
AB We have developed a theory to obtain the surface flux of growing species in MBE, taking account of step kinematics as well as surface diffusion.  This treatment makes it possible to understand the elemental growth process in MBE of III-V alloys.  The MBE experiments are carried out and the solid composition of InGaAs and AlGaAs is measured for the different faces with a different off angle.  Theory shows qualitatively a good agreement with the present experiments suggesting that the role of step kinetics is important in controlling the alloy composition.

TI REEXAMINATION OF THE FORMATION MECHANISM OF CUPT-TYPE NATURAL
   SUPERLATTICES IN ALLOY SEMICONDUCTORS
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MOLECULAR BEAM EPITAXY
CY AUG 27-31, 1990
CL LA JOLLA, CA
HO UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO
ID VAPOR-PHASE EPITAXY; BAND-GAP ENERGY; LONG-RANGE ORDER; GA0.5IN0.5P;
   DEPOSITION; LAYERS; GAINP; GROWTH
AB The previously proposed natural superlattice (NSL) formation mechanism is experimentally re-examined by using Ga0.5In0.5P grown on (001) vicinal (6-degrees off towards the [110BAR] direction) GaAs substrate by metalorganic vapor phase epitaxy (MOVPE).  Based mainly on the experimental results:  non-existence of the (111)B micro-facets at the growing interface and extremely large (several hundred angstrom) single NSL domain sizes compared with the average terrace width (approximately 27 angstrom), a new NSL formation (step-terrace-reconstruction (STR)) mechanism is presented.  The mechanism assumes a reconstruction of the steps and terraces at the column V atom stabilized vicinal (001) surface, on which parity of the number of the column III atoms for each terrace is even.
RP SUZUKI, T (reprint author), NEC CORP LTD,OPTOELECTR RES LABS,4-1-1 MIYAZAKI,MIYAMAE KU,KAWASAKI,KANAGAWA 213,JAPAN.

TI OBSERVATION OF DARK LINE DEFECTS IN INGAAS/GAAS STRAINED LAYER
   SUPERLATTICES BY PHOTOLUMINESCENCE TOPOGRAPHY
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MOLECULAR BEAM EPITAXY
CY AUG 27-31, 1990
CL LA JOLLA, CA
HO UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO
ID QUANTUM WELLS
AB The behavior of dark line defects (DLDs) in molecular beam epitaxy grown InGaAs/GaAs strained layer superlattices (SLSs) has been studied by photoluminescence (PL) topography.  The density of DLDs parallel to the [011] was larger than that of those perpendicular to the [011] and increased with increasing number of SLS periods.  These DLDs were considered to be originated from the locally deformed lattices by the misfit stress.  The relaxation model of stress in MBE-grown InGaAs/GaAs SLSs was proposed from the obtained results.
RP IIZUKA, K (reprint author), NIPPON INST TECHNOL,4-1 GAKUENDAI,SAITAMA 345,JAPAN.

TI SEQUENTIAL LOCATION-ALLOCATION OF PUBLIC FACILITIES IN ONE-DIMENSIONAL
   AND 2-DIMENSIONAL SPACE - COMPARISON OF SEVERAL POLICIES
SO MATHEMATICAL PROGRAMMING
LA English
DT Article
DE SEQUENTIAL LOCATION-ALLOCATION; PUBLIC FACILITIES; EFFICIENCY; POLICY
   COMPARISON
ID COMPETITION; FIRMS
AB The present paper examines the sequential location-allocation problems of public facilities in one- and two-dimensional space under several policies.  It is shown that the efficiency loss due to the adoption of a myopic policy is not so large, contrary to common belief, provided that the efficiency can be measured by the total transportation cost of users and by the total capacity of facilities.  If the total serving area is "sufficiently narrow", then the spatial allocations of optimal solutions in two-dimensional problems can be closely approximated by those in one-dimensional problems.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,DEPT URBAN ENGN,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI REMOVAL KINETICS OF PHOSPHORUS IN PLATING WASTE SOLUTION BY USING
   YATUGATAKE VOLCANIC ASH SOILS
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
AB Removal characteristics of phosphonate and phosphinate ions in electroless nickel plating waste solution with Yatugatake volcanic ash soil (Y-2) have been investigated from the standpoint of chemical kinetics.
   Phosphonate and phosphinate ions in solution have been found to be removed by an anion-exchange reaction between the ions in solution and OH- ions of Y-2, accompanied with a neutralization reaction between H+ ions in solution and OH- ions of Y-2.
   Rate determing steps of the removal reactions have been estimated to be a film diffusion control and the film mass transfer coefficients for the phosphonate and posphinate ions were 1.7 x 10(-4) cm/s and 5.0 x 10(-5) cm/s, respectively.
C1 YAMANASHI UNIV,FAC ENGN,KOFU,YAMANASHI 400,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,INST IND SCI,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

AU SATO, T
   TANAKA, T
   SUZUKI, T
AF SATO, T

   SUZUKI, T
TI A NEW PRACTICAL DISINFECTION METHOD FOR DRINKING-WATER BY USING AN
   ELECTRODIALYSIS SYSTEM WITH ION-EXCHANGE MEMBRANCES
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
AB A new practical disinfection method for drinking water has been developed by using an electrodialysis system with cation- and anion-exchange membranes.
   Short distance between the membranes, large effective area of the membranes and slow flow rate of E. coli suspended solutions through the desalting chamber have been found to be effective for the practical purpose.  Perfect devitalization of the Tama river has been possible by using a practical handy electrodialysis system (0.24 or 0.48 A.dm-2) with the distance of 0.02 dm between the ion-exchange membranes, the effective membrane area of 2.09 dm2 and flow rates of 0.3 approximately 0.5 dm3.min-1.

TI STUDY OF 360-GEV/C PROTON-NUCLEUS INTERACTIONS USING CERN HOLOGRAPHIC
   BUBBLE-CHAMBER
SO NUOVO CIMENTO DELLA SOCIETA ITALIANA DI FISICA A-NUCLEI PARTICLES AND
   FIELDS
LA English
DT Article
DE HADRON-INDUCED HIGH-ENERGY AND SUPER-HIGH-ENERGY; INTERACTIONS
   (ENERGY-GREATER-THAN-10GEV)
ID MULTI-CHAIN MODEL; HIGH-ENERGY; HADRON-NUCLEUS; MONTE-CARLO;
   O-16-NUCLEUS COLLISIONS; FINITE TEMPERATURE; MULTIPLICITY; MATTER;
   GEV/C; DISTRIBUTIONS
AB The study of high-energy proton-nucleus collisions is done with a holographic film from the exposure of CERN heavy liquid bubble chamber (HOBC) to a 360 GeV/c proton beam. The multiplicity, the pseudorapidity distributions of its secondary charged particles and their correlations are analysed and compared with those of some Monte Carlo event generators. Results suggest that the multichain model including the concept of formation zone is suitable to reproduce our experimental data. It is found that the intranuclear cascade process is important in order to describe the production mechanism, especially in the backward hemisphere, of high-energy proton-nucleus collisions.

TI NUCLEAR MAGNETIC-RELAXATION OF LOW CARRIER SYSTEM YB4AS3
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON VALENCE FLUCTUATIONS
CY JUL 09-13, 1990
CL RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL
SP CONSELHO NACL PESQUISAS, FINANCIADORA ESTUDOS & PROJETOS, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA SAO PAULO, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA RIO DE JANEIRO, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA RIO GRANDE DO SUL, IBM BRAZIL, NATL SCI FDN, INT CTR THEORET PHYS, UNIV CAMPINAS
AB A heavy-fermion compound with very low carrier concentration, Yb4As3, was investigated with the As-75 nuclear quadrupole resonance (NQR) technique between 2 and 200 K.  The spin lattice relaxation rate, 1/T1, follows the T1T = constant law in the very narrow temperature range between 10 and 20 K and becomes almost independent of temperature below 4 K, which suggests that the ground-state properties of Yb4As3 are not so simple to be described by the Fermi liquid picture.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI TRANSPORT AND MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES OF SM MONOPNICTIDES
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON VALENCE FLUCTUATIONS
CY JUL 09-13, 1990
CL RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL
SP CONSELHO NACL PESQUISAS, FINANCIADORA ESTUDOS & PROJETOS, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA SAO PAULO, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA RIO DE JANEIRO, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA RIO GRANDE DO SUL, IBM BRAZIL, NATL SCI FDN, INT CTR THEORET PHYS, UNIV CAMPINAS
AB The temperature dependence of the magnetic suceptibility of SmSb could not be explained by the simple model with crystal field and spin-orbit interaction, but it was necessary to introduce a Kondo type exchange of about 300 K due to a GAMMA-8 state.  The specific heat peak at T(N) in SmSb was not influenced by applied magnetic fields even up to 10 T.  This suggests a strong competition between the Kondo and the usual exchange acting on the localized spin.  The dHvA effect was observed above and below T(N).

TI ON THE COMMON FEATURE OF THE OPTICAL REFLECTIVITY IN RARE-EARTH
   MONOPNICTIDES DUE TO 5D ELECTRON SCREENING
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON VALENCE FLUCTUATIONS
CY JUL 09-13, 1990
CL RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL
SP CONSELHO NACL PESQUISAS, FINANCIADORA ESTUDOS & PROJETOS, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA SAO PAULO, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA RIO DE JANEIRO, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA RIO GRANDE DO SUL, IBM BRAZIL, NATL SCI FDN, INT CTR THEORET PHYS, UNIV CAMPINAS
AB Reflectivity spectra of single crystals of LaSb, CeSb, PrSb and SmSb were measured in the photon energy range from 0.001 to 20 eV.  All the spectra show absorptions due to the p-d transitions which screen the p-d bonding state and the p-d antibonding state at around 6 and 12 eV, respectively.  The additional absorption was found at around 1 eV and its intensity is proportional to the number of occupied 4f electrons.

TI KONDO BEHAVIOR IN AN EXTREMELY LOW CARRIER CONCENTRATION SYSTEM - CEP
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON VALENCE FLUCTUATIONS
CY JUL 09-13, 1990
CL RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL
SP CONSELHO NACL PESQUISAS, FINANCIADORA ESTUDOS & PROJETOS, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA SAO PAULO, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA RIO DE JANEIRO, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA RIO GRANDE DO SUL, IBM BRAZIL, NATL SCI FDN, INT CTR THEORET PHYS, UNIV CAMPINAS
AB Electrical resistivity, magnetic susceptibility and specific heat under a magnetic field were measured in single crystalline CeP.  The exerpiments show a Kondo behaviour of the system caused by a GAMMA-8 exited state at high temperatures, and a large mass enhancement caused by a GAMMA-7 ground state at low temperatures.  An interesting magnetic phase diagram was also obtained.
C1 CASIO LTD,HACHIOJI RES CTR,HACHIOJI,JAPAN.

   HULLIGER F, 1978, Z PHYS B, V20, P47
   KOMATSUBARA T, 1980, J MAGN MAGN MATER, V15-8, P963, DOI 10.1016/0304-8853(80)90844-6

TI SPECIFIC-HEAT IN A MAGNETIC-FIELD FOR THE EXTREMELY LOW CARRIER SYSTEM
   YB4AS3
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON VALENCE FLUCTUATIONS
CY JUL 09-13, 1990
CL RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL
SP CONSELHO NACL PESQUISAS, FINANCIADORA ESTUDOS & PROJETOS, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA SAO PAULO, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA RIO DE JANEIRO, FUNDACAO AMPARO PESQUISA RIO GRANDE DO SUL, IBM BRAZIL, NATL SCI FDN, INT CTR THEORET PHYS, UNIV CAMPINAS
AB Yb4As3 has an extremely low carrier concentration, which is estimated to be 0.1% per Yb ion, from Hall coefficient and optical reflectivity measurements.  The gamma value for Yb4As3 has a value as large as 200 mJ/mole K2 per Yb3+ ion.  This gamma value, the extrapolated magnetic susceptibility at 0 K, and the coefficient of T2 in the temperature dependence of the resistivity nearly satisfy the universal relations expected for the heavy fermions.
   It is hard to understand all these physical properties using a simple extension of the impurity Kondo conception.  It is widely believed that Kondo or heavy-fermion systems require a lot of carriers to compensate the magnetic moment.  The question is whether it is possible to have a heavy-fermion system with such a low carrier concentration.  In order to try and answer this question, we measured the specific heat as a function of temperature, lowering it to 1.5 K, for magnetic fields up to 10 T.  It was observed that the linear relation between C/T and T2 was broken by the magnetic field, and that a hump in the specific heat appeared at about 3 T.  The position of this hump is shifted to higher T when the field is increased.  The total entropy seems to be field independent at high temperatures.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,OARAI BRANCH,OARAI,JAPAN.
   CASIO LTD,HACHIOJI RES CTR,HACHIOJI,JAPAN.
RP NAKAMURA, O (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

   KOWN YS, 1987, J MAGN MAGN MATER, V70, P397
   OCHIAI A, IN PRESS J PHYS SOC

TI OXYGEN-LOSS EFFECTS ON SUPERCONDUCTIVITY OF BI2SR2CACU2OY SYSTEM
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID COPPER-OXIDE SUPERCONDUCTORS; HIGH-TC SUPERCONDUCTIVITY;
   ELECTRONIC-STRUCTURE; PHYSICAL-PROPERTIES; HOLE CONCENTRATION;
   TL2BA2CUO6; TRANSITION; INSULATOR; BISMUTH; STATE
AB The properties of Bi2Sr2CaCu2Oy annealed at 200-650-degrees-C in vacuum (10(-4)Pa) are studied by x-ray powder diffraction, ac magnetization, and Hall measurement.  The amount of oxygen loss, DELTA-y, was obtained by an integration of the oxygen partial pressure measured by a quadrupole mass spectrometer.  The T(c) increases from 65 to 92 K, which is accompanied by a small amount of oxygen loss (on the order of 10(-3)). The a and c axes are extended by the oxygen loss.  The change of the hole concentration estimated by Hall measurement is of the same order of magnitude as that for the other superconducting oxides against the change of T(c), however, it is larger by about two orders of magnitude than that expected from the oxygen loss.  This discrepancy suggests charge redistribution in the structure.

TI LARGE-AREA DOPING FOR POLY-SI THIN-FILM TRANSISTORS USING BUCKET
   ION-SOURCE WITH AN RF PLASMA CATHODE
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE POLY-SI TFTS; LARGE-AREA DOPING; BUCKET ION SOURCE; PLASMA CATHODE; XECL
   EXCIMER LASER; IMPURITY DOPING
AB In order to realize stable processing of large-area ion doping, a filament-less bucket ion source with an rf plasma cathode (RFC) was studied and applied to the fabrication of poly crystalline Si thin film transistors (poly-Si TFTs).  By using Ar as a discharge gas, the RFC can be utilized for the bucket ion source instead of a hot filament cathode (HFC).  The throughput, uniformity of the sheet resistance and the characteristics of the fabricated TFTs were equivalent to those of a hot filament cathode type ion source.  This technique seems applicable to the doping process of poly-Si TFTs.
C1 GTC,CYUO KU,TOKYO 103,JAPAN.

TI 3D METAL-SUBSTITUTION EFFECTS ON MAGNETIC AND CRYSTALLOGRAPHIC
   PROPERTIES OF CRAS
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 35TH ANNUAL CONF ON MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
CY OCT 29-NOV 01, 1990
CL SAN DIEGO, CA
SP AMER INST PHYS, IEEE, MAGNET SOC, AMER INST MIN MET & PETR ENGINEERS, MET SOC, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, AMER SOC TESTING & MAT, AMER PHYS SOC, AMER CERAM SOC
AB Crystal structure parameter of Cr(1-x)M(x)As (M = Ti, Fe, Co, and Ni; x less-than-or-equal-to 0.1) have been precisely determined as a function of temperature from 77 to 320 K.  Discontinuous changes of lattice parameters have been observed at a special temperature.  By this temperature the Neel temperatures T(N) of Cr(1-x)M(x)As have been determined because the anomaly of magnetic susceptibility has not been observed for them.  The substitutions by the M atoms generally make T(N) of CrAs decrease remarkably.  For the Fe, Co, and Ni substitutions, a nonmagnetic state is expected for a concentration more than 5%, 6%, and 9%, respectively.  Dependence of T(N) on the substituent concentrations has been determined by taking account of the crystal volume effect on T(N).
RP SUZUKI, T (reprint author), TOHOKU GAKUIN UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL PHYS,TAGAJO,MIYAGI 985,JAPAN.

TI PRESSURE-INDUCED ELECTRICAL AND MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES IN CEAS, CESB AND
   CEBI
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 35TH ANNUAL CONF ON MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
CY OCT 29-NOV 01, 1990
CL SAN DIEGO, CA
SP AMER INST PHYS, IEEE, MAGNET SOC, AMER INST MIN MET & PETR ENGINEERS, MET SOC, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, AMER SOC TESTING & MAT, AMER PHYS SOC, AMER CERAM SOC
AB Electrical resistance of single-crystalline CeAs, CeSb, and CeBi has been measured under hydrostatic pressure.  In CeAs and CeSb, pressure enhances the change of overall features in the resistance-temperature R(T) curves.  Resistance anomalies associated with magnetic phase transitions are observed and are found to be sensitive to pressure.  It is noted that the R(T) curve of CeAs at approximately 3 GPa is similar to that of CeSb at ambient pressure.

TI MAGNETIC AND MAGNETOOPTIC PROPERTIES OF RAPID THERMALLY CRYSTALLIZED
   GARNET-FILMS
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 35TH ANNUAL CONF ON MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
CY OCT 29-NOV 01, 1990
CL SAN DIEGO, CA
SP AMER INST PHYS, IEEE, MAGNET SOC, AMER INST MIN MET & PETR ENGINEERS, MET SOC, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, AMER SOC TESTING & MAT, AMER PHYS SOC, AMER CERAM SOC
AB A new technique to improve the morphology of sputter-deposited bismuth garnet films for optical storage is discussed.  This technique employs high ramp-up rate annealing in a nitrogen atmosphere, which leads to a smaller grain size and smooth surface than a conventional oven annealing or in situ crystallization process during film growth.  By utilizing this technique, the films can be successfully crystallized to the grain size of about 200-300 angstrom, and a high coercivity (greater or similar to kOe).  Multilayer films of garnets with other additions such as Cr and SiO(x) are also discussed.  These multilayer films can provide better morphology and high coercivity.

TI SEARCH FOR SUPERMASSIVE RELICS WITH A 2000-M2 ARRAY OF PLASTIC TRACK
   DETECTORS
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID MAGNETIC MONOPOLES; FLUX; PARTICLES; PHASES; LIMITS
AB A direct search has been made for supermassive relics (heavier than about 10(12) GeV/c2) with a 2000-m2 array of CR-39 track-etch detectors deployed underground for 2.1 yr.  The nonobservation of penetrating tracks places a new upper limit for the velocity-dependent flux at 3.2 x 10(-16) cm-2 s-1 sr-1, for magnetic monopoles carrying various magnetic charges, for electrically charged relics, and for strange matter.  This flux limit corresponds to a limit on the relic abundance of order n(x)/n-gamma = 10(-29) relative to the 3-K photons.
C1 WASEDA UNIV,SCI & ENGN RES LAB,TOKYO 162,JAPAN.

TI A TI-LINBO3 OPTICAL-INTENSITY MODULATOR WITH MORE THAN 20 GHZ BANDWIDTH
   AND 5.2-V DRIVING VOLTAGE
SO IEEE PHOTONICS TECHNOLOGY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB This paper describes a broad-band and low driving-voltage Ti:LiNbO3 optical intensity modulator.  A coplanar waveguide with a shielding plane is used for optical-electrical velocity matching and a confined waveguide is used for lowering the driving voltage.  The relationship between the mode size of the guided wave and the driving voltage is shown.  This modulator has an electrical 3-dB bandwidth of more than 20 GHz and a driving voltage of 5.2 V at a wavelength of 1.5-mu-m.
RP NOGUCHI, K (reprint author), NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,OPT ELECTR LABS,ATSUGI,KANAGAWA 24301,JAPAN.

TI DEVELOPMENT OF AN AUTOMATIC ESTIMATION SYSTEM FOR BOTH THE
   PARTITION-COEFFICIENT AND AQUEOUS SOLUBILITY
SO JOURNAL OF COMPUTER-AIDED MOLECULAR DESIGN
LA English
DT Article
DE AQUEOUS SOLUBILITY; PARTITION COEFFICIENT; HYDROPHOBICITY; GROUP
   CONTRIBUTION METHOD; DRUG DESIGN; STRUCTURE-PROPERTY CORRELATION
ID WATER
AB A computer program has been developed for estimating both the partition coefficient between 1-octanol and water phases and the aqueous solubility from the structural formula. This system is an extended version of a previously described program entitled CHEMICALC for the automatic estimation of the partition coefficient. The aqueous solubility is estimated via two pathways. The first is based on the linear relationship between logarithms of the aqueous solubilities of 497 compounds and their estimated 1-octanol/water partition coefficients. In the second, combined handling of two available group contribution methods of Irmann [Chem. Ing. Tech., 37 (1965) 789] and Wakita et al. [Chem. Pharm. Bull., 34 (1986) 4663] is adopted according to compound type. Some revisions and extensions of the methods for estimating the aqueous solubility have been made in both pathways, and the accuracy of the estimated aqueous solubilities for 497 compounds is discussed.
C1 TOKYO INST TECHNOL,DEPT CHEM ENGN,MEGURO KU,TOKYO 152,JAPAN.

TI AN ATM SWITCHING-SYSTEM - DEVELOPMENT AND EVALUATION
SO NEC RESEARCH & DEVELOPMENT
LA English
DT Article
DE ATM (ASYNCHRONOUS TRANSFER MODE); BROAD-BAND ISDN; SWITCHING SYSTEM;
   MULTIMEDIA; SMDS
AB This paper describes an experimental ATM (Asynchronous Transfer Mode) switching system recently developed by NEC.  This is the first practical ATM switching system developed that conforms to CCITT Recommendations on cell format.  The system has several outstanding features.  It has a building block configuration with SDH (Synchronous Digital Hierarchy) standard interfaces between modules.  This, together with its distributed architecture, makes the system flexible and economical enough to meet a wide range of future service demands.  The ATM switch element developed for this system is of the output-buffer type, which facilitates multicast connections and prioritization.  By using a three-stage configuration of switch elements, it is possible to realize a large-capacity non-blocking switch.  A terminal adaptor and performance analyzer were also developed to evaluate the performance of the switching system.
RP SUZUKI, K (reprint author), NEC CORP LTD,DEPT SWITCHING SYST ENGN 1,DIV INTEGRATED SWITCHING DEV,KAWASAKI,KANAGAWA 213,JAPAN.

TI ADSORBATE INTERACTION BETWEEN CARBON-MONOXIDE AND ETHYLENE OVER
   GAMMA-AL2O3
SO REACTION KINETICS AND CATALYSIS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID PULSE
AB CO and/or ethylene adsorbed on gamma-Al2O3 was subjected to temperature programmed desorption (TPD).  When temperature of the gas adsorbed specimens was linearly raised, two peaks were observed in desorption profile of both ethylene and that of CO.  When an equimolecular mixture of carbon monoxide and ethylene was adsorbed over the specimen, desorption temperature of CO(H) shifted to high temperature side of 87.2-degrees-C, whereas that of ethylene (H) shifted to low temperature side of 33.0-degrees-C.  This behavior of desorption temperature might be attributed to a strong interaction in the two adsorbates induced by an electronic effect.

TI NEGATIVE PION-PRODUCTION IN SUBTHRESHOLD HEAVY-ION COLLISIONS
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID NEUTRAL PIONS; 85A MEV; ENERGY; BEAMS; EMISSION; NE
AB Inclusive pi- spectra have been measured for N-14 + C collisions at 41A, 67A, 80A and 135A MeV, the lowest energies measured for the charged pion.  The cross sections fall exponentially with T-pi and the exponential slope factors at 90-degrees in the nucleon-nucleon center of mass frame are determined.  Energy distributions below a beam energy of 100A MeV are less steep than expected from the monotonic decrease of the slope factor down to 100A MeV.  The production mechanism of energetic pions far below threshold is discussed for several models.
C1 KEK NAT LAB HIGH ENERGY PHYS,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI BRST-INVARIANT NONPLANAR PRIMITIVE OPERATORS IN THE OPEN-BOSONIC-STRING
   THEORY
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW D
LA English
DT Article
ID COVARIANT LOOP-CALCULUS; DUAL-RESONANCE MODEL; B-GHOST INSERTION;
   MULTILOOP AMPLITUDE; MODULAR INVARIANCE; QUANTUM GEOMETRY; TADPOLE
   OPERATOR; VERTEX; VACUUM
AB We investigate nonplanar operators in the open-bosonic-string theory by means of the covariant operator formalism based on the Becchi-Rouet-Stora-Tyutin (BRST) formulation.  The detailed evaluations of two nonplanar primitive operators, that is, nonplanar self-energy and nonplanar two-loop tadpole, are presented.  At the one-loop level, we show that the ghost contribution yields a right measure factor to the physical amplitude.  For the nonplanar two-loop tadpole operator, we discuss the factorization of the nonplanar self-energy.  In order to avoid multiple countings, the integration regions are suitably restricted by investigating the duality of the 5-Reggeon vertex and the periodicity of the nonplanar self-energy operator.  We also argue that only one singularity associated with the nonplanar self-energy part occurs in the nonplanar two-loop tadpole.
RP KOBAYASHI, T (reprint author), UNIV TSUKUBA,INST PHYS,SAKURA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI LASER-ASSISTED SCANNING TUNNELING MICROSCOPY
SO JOURNAL OF VACUUM SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 5TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SCANNING TUNNELING MICROSCOPY/SPECTROSCOPY (
   STM 90 ) / 1ST INTERNATIONAL CONF ON NANOMETER SCALE SCIENCE AND
   TECHNOLOGY ( NANO 1 )
CY JUL 23-27, 1990
CL BALTIMORE, MD
SP AMER VACUUM SOC, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, USAF, OFF SCI RES, NATL SCI FDN, JOHN HOPKINS UNIV, APPL PHYS LAB
ID FREQUENCIES; GENERATION; MICROWAVE; JUNCTION
AB Infrared laser radiation is coupled via the tip into the tunneling junction of a scanning tunneling microscope.  Rectification and difference frequency generation of the laser light caused by the nonlinearity in the current-voltage characteristic of the junction are observed.  Images with atomic resolution are obtained either by recording the rectified signal or by measuring the intensity at the difference frequency when the tip is scanned across the surface.  These images are compared with others obtained in the conventional way by observing the tunneling current.
C1 UNIV MUNICH,SEKT PHYS,W-8046 GARCHING,GERMANY.

TI LIQUID-PHASE AUTOXIDATION OF 1,2,3,4-TETRAHYDROQUINOLINE CATALYZED BY
   TRANSITION-METAL SALTS-BROMIDE IONS IN ACETIC-ANHYDRIDE
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
AB The oxidation of 1,2,3,4-tetrahydroquinoline (THQ) was investigated to provide new utilizations of quinoline, a major component of tar bases in coal tar and coal liquid.  The oxidation proceeded smoothly by molecular oxygen in acetic anhydride in the presence of catalytic amounts of transition metal acetates and certain bromides, affording 1-acetyl-4-acetoxy-1,2,3,4-tetrahydroquinoline (AATHQ) and 1-acetyl-2,3-dihydro-4(1H)-quinolinone (ADHQ) as main products.
   Active catalyst systems were Co(II)-NH4Br, Co(II)-Mn(II)-NH4Br, and Co(II)-Ce(III)-NH4Br, optimum Co(II) concentration and Br/Co ratio being 6.0 x 10(-2) mol/kg and 2.0, respectively, in Co(II)-NH4Br catalyzed reactions.
   The effects of reaction temperatures, concentrations of THQ, and weight ratios of acetic anhydride to acetic acid on the oxidation yield were also examined.  The oxidation of THQ catalyzed by Co(II)-NH4Br in acetic anhydride at 110-degrees-C produced AATHQ in 60% yield.
C1 DU PONT MITSUI,POLYCHEM CO LTD,ICHIHARA 29901,JAPAN.
   NIPPON KOKAN KK,TECH RES CTR,KAWASAKI 210,JAPAN.
RP YAZU, K (reprint author), NATL RES INST POLLUT & RESOURCES,TSUKUBA 305,JAPAN.

TI STRUCTURAL, NORMAL-STATE, AND SUPERCONDUCTING PROPERTIES OF
   (LA1-XBAX-YSRY)2CUO4
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID HIGH-TC SUPERCONDUCTIVITY; TRANSITION; PHASE; (LA1-XSRX)2CUO4;
   (LA1-XBAX)2CUO4-DELTA; LA2-XSRXCUO4-Y; DEPENDENCE; TRANSPORT; HEAT
AB We report on the interplay among the structural transitions, transport anomalies and superconductivity in (La(1-x)Ba(x-y)Sr(y))2CuO4.  For (La(1-x)Ba(x))2CuO4 (y = 0), it is now well established that high-T(c) superconductivity is suppressed in a narrow range of x around 0.0625.  In this study, the amount of doping is held at x = 0.0625 and the structural transition temperatures are controlled by a new parameter y.  The appearance of the low-temperature tetragonal (TLT) phase and the depression of superconductivity correlate well, but unlike in (La(1-x)Ba(x))2CuO4 the transport anomalies can be decoupled from the structural transition, implying the presence of a new instability in the electronic state, which precedes the structural transition to the TLT phase.
RP MAENO, Y (reprint author), HIROSHIMA UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,HIROSHIMA 730,JAPAN.

TI OXIDATIVE CLEAVAGE OF DISELENIDE BY META-NITROBENZENESULFONYL PEROXIDE -
   NOVEL METHOD FOR THE ELECTROPHILIC BENZENESELENENYLATIONS OF OLEFINS AND
   AROMATIC RINGS
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID DIPHENYL DISELENIDE; ELECTROCHEMICAL OXYSELENENYLATION; HIGHLY
   EFFICIENT; SELENIUM; TRIFLATE; CYCLIZATION; OXYSELENATION; REAGENTS;
   CHLORIDE; ETHERS
AB Diphenyl diselenide was found to be readily converted into benzeneselenenyl m-nitrobenzenesulfonate (PhSeOSO2C6H4NO2-m) by treating with m-nitrobenzenesulfonyl peroxide.  When the selenenyl sulfonate thus formed was allowed to react in situ with olefins, such as cyclohexene, l-octene, or styrene, in the presence of various nucleophiles, the adducts of benzeneselenenyl group and a nucleophile were obtained.  As the nucleophiles water, methanol, acetic acid, phenol, and anisole could be employed; oxyselenenylated (PhSe-C-C-OR:  R = H, Me, Ac, and Ph) and arylselenenylated (PhSe-C-C-C6H4OR:  R = H and Me) adducts were afforded.  Phenol gave oxyselenenylated products in cyclohexene or 1-octene and arylselenenylated products in styrene.  Efficient intramolecular cyclizations of unsaturated alcohols and carboxylic acids were similarly performed by the selenenyl sulfonate to afford corresponding benzeneselenenylated cyclic ethers and lactones.  The selenenyl sulfonate was also found to be a highly reactive benzeneselenenylating reagent for aromatic rings, such as anisole, phenol, acetanilide, toluene, and benzene.
RP YOSHIDA, M (reprint author), TOKYO METROPOLITAN UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,SETAGAYA KU,TOKYO 158,JAPAN.

TI ADVANCE ON UNDERGROUND RADARS

TI NEW THERMOTROPIC LIQUID-CRYSTALLINE POLYESTERS WITH A METAL-CHELATED
   1,3-DIPHENYL-1,3-PROPANEDIONE SEGMENT
SO MAKROMOLEKULARE CHEMIE-MACROMOLECULAR CHEMISTRY AND PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID POLYMERS; TRANSITION
AB New thermotropic liquid-crystalline polyesters (2-4) containing a mesogenic beta-diketone segment, which can coordinate to a metal ion as bidentate ligand, were synthesized by polycondensation of a mixture of 1,6-hexanediol (x mol), 1,3-bis(p-hydroxyphenyl)-1,3-propanedione (y mol), and 4,4'-hexamethylenedioxydibenzoyl chloride (x + y mol).  Homopolyester 1, prepared from 1,6-hexanediol and 4,4'-hexamethylenedioxydibenzoyl chloride, and copolyesters 2 and 3 (x/y = 0,8/0,2 and 0,5/0,5, respectively) show a nematic phase, whereas homopolyester 4, prepared from 1,3-bis(p-hydroxyphenyl)-1,3-propanedione and 4,4'-hexamethylenedioxydibenzoyl chloride, exhibits a smectic phase.  The wide-angle X-ray diffraction patterns from the melt-drawn fibers prepared at mesophase temperatures suggested no orientation for 1, a monoaxial orientation and a crystalline state for 2, a monoaxial orientation and a frozen-in nematic phase for 3, and a biaxial orientation and a frozen-in smectic A phase for 4.  Introduction of a transition metal (CuCl2 or NiCl2) into copolyesters 2 and 3 gave the corresponding metal-chelated thermotropic liquid-crystalline polyesters (5a-c, 6a-c, and 7a-c).  Formation of a metal complex among polymer chains by introduction of a metal ion also resulted in better monoaxial orientation according to X-ray diffraction patterns.  The ESR spectra of fibers of copper-containing polyesters (5a-c and 6a-c) indicated that the plane of the square planar copper complex in the polymers is oriented parallel to the fiber axis.
RP HANABUSA, K (reprint author), SHINSHU UNIV,DEPT FUNCT POLYMER SCI,UEDA 386,JAPAN.

TI SHUBNIKOV-DEHAAS EFFECT IN EXTREMELY LOW CARRIER KONDO SYSTEM CEAS
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 19TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON LOW TEMPERATURE PHYSICS ( LT-19 )
CY AUG 16-22, 1990
CL BRIGHTON, ENGLAND
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS, ELSEVIER NORTH HOLLAND PUBL, UNIV SUSSEX, INST PHYS, USAF, GEC
AB We could measure the Shubnikov-de Haas effect in good quality single crystal of CeAs obtained by well controlling its stoichiometry.  It revealed that carrier concentrations were extremely low to be about 0.001/Ce and showed dense Kondo behavior.

TI EFFECT OF COMPLEX DOPANTS (LI+ WITH AL3+) SUBSTITUTED FOR CU IONS IN
   PREPARING THE SUPERCONDUCTING YBCO
SO SOLID STATE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID YBA2CU3O7-X; MECHANISM; BA2YCU3O7; SYSTEM; OXIDES
AB The effect of complex dopants (Li+ with Al3+) substituted for Cu ions was examined in preparing the superconducting YBCO.  The same amount of Li+ and Al3+ was simultaneously prescribed to prepare target compounds of the nominal composition YBa2 Cu3-2x (LiAl)x O7-delta.  Specimens with dilute concentration of the complex-dopants (x < 0.1) composed a single phase of the normal YBCO-type crystallite with good superconductivity.  Specimens with heavy concentration of the complex-dopants (0.2 < x < 0.7) were not single phase, but contained crystalline domains of the normal YBCO structure and showed, as a whole, better superconductivity than the specimens of a nominal composition YBa2 Cu3-2xO7-delta without substitutional dopants for all values of x.  Therefore, the complex-dopants (Li+ with Al3+) substituted for Cu ions exert interesting effects in preparing the superconducting YBCO.
C1 SOPHIA UNIV,DEPT NAT SCI,CHIYODA KU,TOKYO 102,JAPAN.

TI PREPARATION OF POLY(DIMETHYLSILOXANE) MACROMONOMERS HAVING ETHYNYLENE
   FUNCTIONALITY BY THE INITIATOR METHOD
SO MACROMOLECULES
LA English
DT Article
ID POLYMERIZATION; COPOLYMERS; MACROMERS
AB Novel poly(dimethylsiloxane) macromonomers with a (trimethylsily)ethynyl group at one end and a trimethylsilyl or (methacryloxypropyl)dimethylsilyl group at the other end have been obtained by nonequilibrium polymerization of hexamethylcyclotrisiloxane using lithium (trimethylsilyl)acetylide as initiator.  The macromonomer with the methacrylic group was copolymerized with methyl methacrylate by a radical process with the (trimethylsilyl)ethynyl groups remaining unchanged.

TI YAGI-UDA ARRAY FOR MILLIMETER-WAVE IMAGING
SO ELECTRONICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE ANTENNAS; ANTENNA ARRAYS
AB An imaging array consisting of five Yagi-Uda antennas in a dielectric has been constructed for 50 GHz that has antenna patterns suitable for millimetre-wave applications.  Crosstalk levels of less than -30 dB between adjacent antennas in an f/1.0 imaging array have been measured in 5 GHz model experiments.

TI SURFACE FRACTAL DIMENSION OF MICROPOROUS CARBON-FIBERS BY NITROGEN
   ADSORPTION
SO JOURNAL OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY-FARADAY TRANSACTIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID ANGLE X-RAY; PHYSICAL ADSORPTION; SCATTERING; FIBERS; PARTICLES; NO
AB The surface fractal dimension of three kinds of microporous carbon fibre has been determined from adsorption data of organic molecules of different molecular sizes (MAI method), by detailed N2 adsorption isotherms with the aid of the recently proposed Avnir-Jaroniec theory (AJ method) and by small-angle X-ray scattering (SAXS).  The application conditions of the AJ theory to the N2 adsorption isotherm have been examined.  The surface fractal dimension by the AJ method depends on the range of the fractional filling.  In the fractional filling range ca. 0.8-1.0 the value of the surface fractal dimension is ca. 2.6-2.7 and nearly constant; therefore, this range of adsorption data is suggested for evaluating the fractal dimension by the AJ method.  The surface fractal dimension by the MAI method was 2.3-3.0 and that by SAXS was 2.6-2.8 in dry air.  Thus the AJ method, which uses a single adsorption isotherm, can give a reasonable value of the surface fractal dimension, similar to those given by MAI and SAXS methods.
C1 GAKUSHUIN UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,TOSHIMA KU,TOKYO 171,JAPAN.

TI SIZE EVALUATION OF GRAPHITIC CRYSTALLITES IN ACTIVATED CARBON-FIBERS
   FROM DIAMAGNETIC SUSCEPTIBILITY MEASUREMENTS
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB Diamagnetic susceptibilities of various kinds of activated carbon fibers (ACFs), nonporous carbon black, and Grafoil were measured under an N2 atmosphere in the temperature range of 273 to 423 K.  An empirical relationship between the diamagnetic susceptibility and molecular structure was derived from the literature for polynuclear aromatic compounds without hydrogen atoms.  The unit size of graphitic crystallites in ACFs was evaluated from the derived relationship.

AU MIYAMA, Y

TI AN INVESTIGATION OF NUCLEAR MEDIUM EFFECTS IN THE DIRAC-BRUECKNER
   OPTICAL-POTENTIAL
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID SCATTERING; MATTER
AB The effects of the nuclear medium on relativistic optical potentials in nuclear matter are studied within the framework of the Dirac-Brueckner method.  The medium effects are classified into Pauli blocking, dispersive, and Dirac spinor modification effects, where the last is shown to be most sizable and persistent up to high energies.  Various meson exchange contributions to the spinor modification effect are investigated.  It is shown that pionic contributions to the optical potentials are suppressed because of medium effects.
RP MIYAMA, Y (reprint author), OSAKA UNIV,NUCL PHYS RES CTR,IBARAKI,OSAKA 567,JAPAN.
CR ANASTASIO MR, 1983, PHYS REP, V100, P327, DOI 10.1016/0370-1573(83)90060-1

TI PRODUCTION CROSS-SECTIONS OF TRITIUM IN HIGH-ENERGY NUCLEAR-REACTIONS
   WITH 12 GEV PROTONS
SO APPLIED RADIATION AND ISOTOPES
LA English
DT Article
ID MEDIUM-MASS NUCLEI; 12-GEV PROTONS; SPALLATION
AB Production cross sections of tritium in high energy nuclear reactions with 12 GeV protons were measured for Al, Co, Cu, Nb, Ag, In, Sn, Au and Pb targets.  Large production cross sections of > 500 mb were obtained for Au and Pb targets.  From their atomic weight dependence, tritium cross sections (sigma) in mb can be expressed as a function of target atomic weight (A) by the following simple equation:  sigma-(A) = 95 exp(A/107), which should be useful for predicting unknown cross sections.  Together with other existing data at different energies, the present data suggest that there is no energy dependence of tritium cross section at proton energies above several GeV.
RP NOGUCHI, M (reprint author), NATL LAB HIGH ENERGY PHYS,OHO 1-1,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI ENHANCEMENT OF THE ETHYLENE CONVERSION TO PROPYLENE ON REDUCED MOLYBDENA
   SILICA CATALYST IN THE PRESENCE OF HYDROGEN
SO INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF HYDROGEN ENERGY
LA English
DT Article
ID ETHENE HOMOLOGATION REACTION; OLEFIN METATHESIS
AB Ethylene conversion to propylene was carried out on a reduced silica supported molybdenum oxide catalyst at 473 K.  When a small amount of H-2 was added, the reaction rate was enhanced 9-10 fold as much as that in the absence of H-2.  An attempt to promote yielding propylene from ethylene was achieved by adding H-2.

TI BASIC STUDIES ON POWDER-SENDING DEVICES USING ULTRASONIC VIBRATION
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 11TH SYMP ON ULTRASONIC ELECTRONICS IN JAPAN ( USE 90 )
CY NOV 20-22, 1990
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS
HO DOSHISHA UNIV
DE POWDER-SENDING DEVICE; FLEXURAL PROGRESSIVE WAVE DEVICE; COMPOSITE BAR
   DEVICE; TUNING FORK TYPE DEVICE; LOSSY FLEXURAL TRANSMISSION LINE;
   ULTRASONIC FLOAT; PIEZOELECTRIC NON-AXISYMMETRICAL VIBRATION;
   PIEZOELECTRIC RADIAL VIBRATION
AB This paper deals with two kinds of new powder sending devices using ultrasonic vibration.  First, their construction is described:  one of them utilizes the composite bars in flexural vibration and the other uses a flexural progressive wave along a lossy hollow acrylic pipe.  Secondly, experimental results are reported which reveal that these new devices are effective to send a certain amount of powder.  The latter device in particular is expected to prove an unique and simple method by which to send not only powder but liquid.

TI STUDY OF GLASS TRANSITIONS OF PG EG SOLUTIONS BY PHOTOACOUSTIC METHOD
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 11TH SYMP ON ULTRASONIC ELECTRONICS IN JAPAN ( USE 90 )
CY NOV 20-22, 1990
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS
HO DOSHISHA UNIV
DE PHOTOACOUSTIC; GLASS TRANSITION; PROPYLENE GLYCOL; ETHYLENE GLYCOL;
   RELAXATION
AB The relaxation properties of glass transitions were studied in solutions of propylene glycol and ethylene glycol by frequency dependent photoacoustic measurements.  The parameters of the Vogel-Fulcher law were determined, and the complex specific heat was analyzed by the Cole-Cole plot.  The parameter of the Davidson-Cole formula was found to decrease as the ratio of propylene glycol decreased.

TI SEPARATION OF NONRADIATIVE AND BELOW-GAP EMISSION LIFETIMES IN A HEAVILY
   SI-DOPED GAAS ALGAAS QUANTUM-WELL
SO JOURNAL OF LUMINESCENCE
LA English
DT Article
AB The excitation density dependence of the time-resolved photoluminescence in a heavily Si-doped GaAs/AlGaAs multiple quantum well structure was investigated.  By examining the trap-filling effect of the dominant non-radiative recombination process, we have measured separately the non-radiative recombination lifetime and the below-gap emission lifetime which can be used to analyze the physical mechanism of these recombination processes.  The effect of these recombination processes on the band-to-band emission in the quantum well and its structural dependence became clear quantitatively.

   NOGUCHI, S
TI DEVELOPMENT OF ULTRAHIGH MULTILAYER PWB PROCESSING
SO NEC RESEARCH & DEVELOPMENT
LA English
DT Article
DE PRINTED WIRING BOARD; BASE MATERIAL; LAMINATING; DRILLING; MULTILAYER
AB Ultrahigh density and complexity multilayer printed wiring broards (PWBs) for very large-scale computers are defined as a "Technology Pack" with a much greater number of layers and very complicated pattern density in each layer.  This paper discusses the development of base materials, and laminating and drilling technologies for these PWBs.  (1) As the base material, glass fiber (with reduced flexural strength) reinforced polyimide resin (with high toughness) is used.  (2) A laminating technology using a vacuum press is established to perform void free lamination for 0.1 mm thick dielectric layers.  (3) A drilling technology using a step-feed and double drilling technique is established for drilling more than 20 aspect ratio hole.
RP KUWATA, H (reprint author), NEC CORP LTD,DIV PRINTING WIRING BOARD,KAWASAKI,KANAGAWA 213,JAPAN.

AU ISHII, H
   SUZUKI, T

AF ISHII, H
   SUZUKI, T
   ODASHIMA, T
TI SOLVENT-EXTRACTION OF SOME TERVALENT LANTHANOIDS WITH SALICYLALDEHYDE
   NORMAL-ALKANOHYDRAZONES
SO SOLVENT EXTRACTION AND ION EXCHANGE
LA English
DT Article
ID ACETYLACETONE
AB Salicylaldehyde n-alkanohydrazones (SAAH or H2L) having 1 to 13 carbon atoms in their alkyl chains were synthesized and used for the extraction of some lanthanoid ions (Ln3+) including praseodymium, europium and ytterbium ions from aqueous solutions containing both tri-n-butylphosphate (TBP) and perchlorate into 1,2-dichloroethane.  The extracted species were (Ln3+)(HL-)2(TBP)3(ClO4-) for all SAAH.  The partition coefficients, K(D), of SAAH increased with an increase in the carbon number of the alkyl chain, the increment of log K(D) being 0.64 per a carbon atom.  The acid dissociation constants of SAAH also increased slightly with an increase in the carbon number, but the extraction constants of their lanthanoid complexes were almost independent of the length of the alkyl chain.

TI ULTRATHIN FILMS OF TIN OXIDE FOR GAS SENSOR
SO ANNALES DE CHIMIE-SCIENCE DES MATERIAUX
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 2ND JAPAN-FRANCE MATERIALS SCIENCE SEMINAR : FUNDAMENTAL ASPECTS OF
   ENERGY MATERIALS ( JFMSS-2 )
CY APR 22-25, 1991
CL PARIS, FRANCE
ID BEAM
AB For a better understanding of semiconductor gas sensor, the size effect of tin oxide films (2 to 850 nm thick) was investigated.  Films were prepared by an ion-beam sputtering method.  Thickness dependence of gas sensitivity was measured at 300-degrees-C against 0.5 % hydrogen.  Films between 3.6 and 60 nm showed an extremely high sensitivity of about 10000, while others were almost insensitive.  This was interpreted as a result of preferred oxygen adsorption at grain boundaries.

TI MAGNETIZATION AND AC SUSCEPTIBILITY OF HCP SOLID HE-3 NEAR THE NUCLEAR
   ORDERING TEMPERATURE
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID MULTIPLE-EXCHANGE; BCC
AB The magnetization and the ac susceptibility of hcp solid He-3 have been measured for molar volumes V from 18.34 to 19.29 cm-3/mole at temperatures down to 38 mu-K.  The Weiss temperature obtained from the magnetization is proportional to V 18.4 +/- 0.6.  The Zeeman-exchange relaxation time obtained from the ac susceptibility indicates the appearance of the critical phenomenon for the sample with 19.29 cm-3/mole.

ID INORGANIC CATION-EXCHANGERS; ENAMEL; DEMINERALIZATION; HYDROXYAPATITES;
   ALUMINUM
AB Previous studies have shown that divalent cations such as Sn2+, Zn2+ and Fe2+ are taken up by dental and synthetic hydroxyapatites by a cation-exchange reaction with molar ratios of Ca2+/Sn2+, Zn2+, Fe2+ almost-equal-to 1.0.  In the present study the reaction characteristics of dental apatite and synthetic hydroxyapatites, the latter being model substances of the dental apatites, have been investigated in detail in trivalent cation solutions.  In acidic solutions with pH values below 4.0, Al3+ ions were easily taken up by apatite samples to yield stable amorphous AlPO4.nH-2O.  In alkaline solutions at pH 11.0, however, the Al(OH)-4 formed in solution had a low reactivity with the hydroxyapatite.  La3+ ions reacted with the apatite samples to form stable crystalline LaPO4 in acidic solution.  The ionic radii of Ca2+ (1.05 angstrom) and La3+ (1.22 angstrom) are close enough together that solid solutions could be formed.  XPS studies, however, suggested that an ion-exchange reaction forming a solid solution of La-H apatite would be unlikely.  Both Al3+ and La3+ ions were taken up into the apatites by an attack reaction of these ions for Ca2+ ions of the apatite samples, assisted by loosening the crystal structures of the apatite samples with H+ ions in solution.  These results should provide important physiochemical information for clinical investigations of the roles played by the trivalent cations in inhibiting dental caries and dentine hypersensitivity.

TI APPLICATION OF A LOGARITHMIC AMPLIFIER TO A CHARGE-DIVISION-TYPE
   POSITION-SENSITIVE PROPORTIONAL COUNTER
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7TH SYMP ON X-RAY AND GAMMA-RAY SOURCES AND APPLICATIONS : RADIATION
   MEASUREMENTS AND APPLICATIONS
CY MAY 21-24, 1990
CL ANN ARBOR, MI
SP US DOE, NATL INST STAND & TECHNOL, UNIV MICHIGAN, HENRY FORD HOSP, ALBION COLL, E MICHIGAN UNIV
HO UNIV MICHIGAN
ID RADIOACTIVITY MEASUREMENT; H-3-LABELED GAS
AB Fulfilment of both observation of pulses ranging from about 10 mV to 10 V through ADC and carrying out an arithmetic calculation with small digital errors for such digitized pulses is usually difficult, although it is required in measurements using a charge-division-type position-sensitive proportional counter (PSPC).  However, the use of a logarithmic pulse amplifier sometimes solves this problem.  The advantage of using a logarithmic pulse amplifier is described through the application of the amplifier to absolute-radioactivity measurements of gaseous samples and to the simultaneous measurement of geometrical distributions of neutrons and gamma-rays with the PSPC.

TI STUDY OF THE ISOSCALAR WEAK NEUTRAL CURRENT BY INELASTIC-NU SCATTERING
   FROM C-12 AND B-10
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID PROTON
AB Cross sections of low-energy isoscalar nu-scatterings from C-12 and B-10 are found to be quite sensitive to the strange quark axial-vector current matrix element of the nucleon < N[S-gamma-mu-gamma-5S[N>. Measurement of inelastic-nu scattering from nuclei would be quite useful to study the isoscalar part of the weak neutral current.

TI SYNTHESIS AND CHARACTERIZATION OF PALLADIUM(II) AND PLATINUM(II)
   COMPLEXES CONTAINING MONODENTATE PHOSPHORUS DONATING OR CHELATING
   2-(DIMETHYLPHOSPHINO)PYRIDINE (PME2PY)
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID CIS-TRANS ISOMERIZATION; BRIDGING LIGAND; EQUILIBRIUM ENERGETICS;
   MOLECULAR-STRUCTURES; BINUCLEAR COMPLEXES;
   2-(DIPHENYLPHOSPHINO)PYRIDINE; CRYSTAL
AB The complexes [MX2(PMe2py-P)2] (M = Pd(II), Pt(II); X = Cl, Br, and I) have been synthesized and characterized both in the solid state and in solution by their infrared and H-1, C-13, and P-31 NMR spectra, in addition to an X-ray crystallographic analysis of cis-[PdCl2(PMe2py-P)2].  The latter complex exists as a cis-trans equilibrium mixture in solution, while only the cis isomer has been isolated in the solid state.  The [PdBr2(PMe2py-P)2] complex which has been isolated as the trans isomer shows also the same isomerization in solution, in contrast to [PdBr2(PMe2Ph)2] which exists only as the trans isomer both in the solid state and in solution.  Furthermore, PMe2py has been found to have the ability for chelation via the nitrogen and phosphorus atoms to make a four-membered chelate ring.  The chelate ring in the complexes [PdX(PMe2py)2]Y (X = Cl, Br, and I; Y = ClO4-, PF6-) has been confirmed by infrared spectra and X-ray analysis of cis(P,P)-[PdCl(PMe2py-P,N)(PMe2py-P)]ClO4.  This is the first example in which PMe2py is acting as a chelating ligand.

TI LARGE-AREA DOPING PROCESS FOR FABRICATION OF POLY-SI THIN-FILM
   TRANSISTORS USING BUCKET ION-SOURCE AND XECL EXCIMER LASER ANNEALING
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 22ND INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SOLID STATE DEVICES AND MATERIALS ( SSPM-22 )
CY AUG 22-24, 1990
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS
DE POLY-SI TFT; IMPURITY DOPING; LARGE-AREA DOPING; XECL EXCIMER LASER;
   BUCKET ION SOURCE; LASER ANNEALING; TFT ADDRESSED LCD
ID SILICON
AB A large-area doping process for polycrystalline Si (poly-Si) thin-film transistor addressed liquid crystal displays (TFT/LCD's) has been developed.  A large ion beam that was extracted from the bucket ion source and a XeCl excimer laser were utilized for impurity doping and impurity activation.  A sufficiently low value of sheet resistance (500 +/- 25 OMEGA/open square) was obtained for an implantation time of 10 s. The poly-Si TFT's fabricated by using this technique have good characteristics and uniformity.  This technique seems suitable for the fabrication of large area poly-Si TFT/LCD's.

TI THE MAGNETIC PHASE-TRANSITIONS IN CE-MONOPNICTIDES, STRONG P-F MIXING
   EFFECT
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
ID DIAGRAM; STATE
AB Specific heat of CeBi and CeSb, as well as LaBi and LaSb, was measured from 1.7 to 60 K under magnetic fields of up to 10 T.  A Kondo like peak persists in CeBi in whole the studied region.  In CeSb the effect of magnetic order is more significant but the similar situation exists, even though crossover from the GAMMA-7 dominated to GAMMA-8 dominated Kondo states appears.  The gamma-value is about 20 mJ/mol K2 in both materials with weak field dependence.  Phonon softening effect was also observed.  It was shown that the extended ANNNI model including non-linear interactions can explain the essential feature of the complicated phase diagram in CeSb fairly satisfactorily.
C1 KANAZAWA WOMENS JR COLL,KANAZAWA 92013,JAPAN.

AB Magnetic susceptibility, electrical resistivity, thermopower and specific heat measurements were carried out on a series of ternary compounds of Ce, CeTX (T = Pd and Pt, X = Ga, Ge and Sn).  They were found to be dense Kondo compounds with an antiferromagnetic ordering at low temperatures.

TI DHVA EFFECT IN F-ELECTRON SYSTEMS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
ID ANOMALOUS MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES; CE MONOPNICTIDES; STATE
AB dHvA magnetization of U3P4 and YbAs has been measured.  The measurement for U3P4 in the {1 1 0} plane shows a new branch.  We have observed the dHvA effect in YbAs for the first time.  The observed branches consist of ellipsoids of electron sheets.  These sheets do not change its shape above and below T(N).

TI MAGNETIC PHASE-TRANSITION IN YBAS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
AB Specific heat and neutron diffraction have been measured in the heavy-fermion compound YbAs to investigate the magnetic ordering as a function of temperature and magnetic field.  Below T(N) almost-equal-to 0.5 K YbAs orders with a commensurate structure k = (1, 0, 1/2) and the ordered moment (almost-equal-to 0.6-mu-B) is strongly reduced in comparison with the GAMMA-6 ground state value (1.3-mu-B).  The order parameter and the specific heat exhibit a quite unusual temperature dependence around T(N).
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
   LAB CRYOPHYS,SERV BASSES TEMP,F-38041 GRENOBLE,FRANCE.

TI TRANSPORT-PROPERTIES OF YBAS AND YBP
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
ID HEAVY
AB We report the measurements of electrical resistivity (rho), thermoelectric power (S), magnetoresistance (DELTA-rho-H = rho-H - rho-0) and Hall effect (R(H)) of YbAs and YbP.  Our results confirm the individual role of electrons and holes.  Electrical resistivity is mainly controlled by electrons which appear to be only weakly sensitive to the magnetic transition (T(N) almost-equal-to 500 and 400 mK, respectively), though S(T) shows an indication of Kondo effect due to holes.

TI KONDO EFFECT AND CRYSTAL-FIELD EFFECT IN CENI2SN2
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
AB Measurements of electrical resistivity, magnetic susceptibility and thermoelectric power on single crystal CeNi2Sn2 and of specific heat on the polycrystal sample reveal that this compound is an anisotropic Kondo-lattice system with T(N) = 1.8 K.  The energy level of the first-excited crystal-field doublet is 17 K, which is only twice the Kondo temperature of the ground state doublet.

TI SPECIFIC-HEAT OF ALPHA-(CE1-XLAX)3AL
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
ID VALENCE
AB The specific heat measurements have been performed for alpha-(Ce(1-x)La(x))3Al in a wide temperature range from 1.2 to 300 K.  A structural and magnetic phase diagram was determined from the specific heat.  Analysis is extended for the phonon part assuming the Debye model as well as for the magnetic part in terms of Kondo effect and crystal field effect.

CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
AB We measured the electrical resistivity, magnetic susceptibility and specific heat of CeAs under several magnetic fields and showed that this compound has a Kondo behavior with an extremely low carrier concentration at high temperature.

TI SPECIFIC-HEAT OF (U1-XTHX)NISN
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
ID METALLIC MAGNET UNISN
AB The specific heat C(T) of the pseudo-binary alloys (U(1-x)Th(x))NiSn has been measured for x = 0, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6 and 10.  An abrupt increase in magnetic entropy S(m) at the unusual antiferromagnetic transition temperature appears to indicate a first order phase transition.  The value of S(m) tends to approach R 1n 4 at liquid N2 temperature independently of x.

TI ANISOTROPIC HYBRIDIZATION IN A HEAVY-FERMION COMPOUND UPDIN WITH DOUBLE
   MAGNETIC TRANSITIONS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
AB Magnetic and transport properties of a heavy-fermion compound UPdIn with a ferromagnetic moment of 0.30-mu-B per U atom have been studied on the single crystals.  A strong anisotropy is observed in the magnetization at 4.2 K, susceptibility and resistivity along the a and c-axes of the hexagonal Fe2P-type structure, suggesting highly anisotropic 5f-ligand hybridizations.

TI THERMAL AND ELASTIC PROPERTIES OF UN
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
ID SYSTEMS
AB We report the specific heat and the elastic constants of UN.  The magnetic and electronic part of the specific heat is analyzed by a simple band model, which gives a band width of 200 K and a gamma = 41 mJ/mol K2.  The elastic constants show various hysteretic behaviours in the magnetic fields.

TI PROTON NMR-STUDIES ON HYDROGEN-DOPED HIGH-TC SUPERCONDUCTOR
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
AB Proton NMR in YBa2Cu3O6.94H(x) (x = 0.2 and 0.5) was carried out in order to obtain information about the behavior of the hydrogen and mechanism of the superconductivity.  The hydrogen atoms are moving above 200 K but trapped in the crystal sites below 130 K.  Below T(c), T1(-1) shows an enhancement and sharp decrease with decreasing temperture.

   HIRAOKA, T
TI HEAVY-FERMION AND SEMICONDUCTING PROPERTIES OF THE TERNARY
   URANIUM-COMPOUNDS U3T3SN4 AND U3T3SB4 (T=NI, CU, PD, PT AND AU)
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE; U-COMPOUNDS; STATE
AB We present results of magnetic, transport and calorimetric measurements on U3T3X4 with T = Ni, Cu, Pd, Pt and Au and X = Sn and Sb.  A heavy-fermion behavior manifests itself in U3T3Sn4, where the electronic specific-heat coefficient increases from 90 mJ/K2 mol U for T = Ni and Pt to about 300 mJ/K3 mol U for T = Cu and Au.  We ascribe the mass enhancement to the dehybridization of 5f electrons with the d electrons derived from the T atom.  On the other hand, U3T3Sb4 with T = Ni, Pd and Pt shows a semiconducting behavior with a band gap of about 0.2 eV, whereas U3Cu3Sb4 is a metallic ferromagnet with T(c) = 91 K.  In these antimonides, 5f electrons are localized because of the weak hybridization with the 5p electrons from the Sb atom.  These results indicate that the number of 5p electrons in the present system determines whether the system shows heavy-fermion or semiconducting behavior.
C1 SAGA UNIV,FAC SCI & ENGN,SAGA 840,JAPAN.
   SAGA UNIV,FAC SCI,SAGA 840,JAPAN.
RP TAKABATAKE, T (reprint author), HIROSHIMA UNIV,FAC INTEGRATED ARTS & SCI,HIROSHIMA 730,JAPAN.

AF KURASAWA, H
   SUZUKI, T
TI THE OMEGA-MESON MASS AND THE NUCLEON SIZE IN NUCLEI
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID QUASIELASTIC ELECTRON-SCATTERING; COULOMB SUM-RULE; RESPONSE FUNCTIONS;
   LONGITUDINAL RESPONSE; FINITE NUCLEI; CA-40; APPROXIMATION; MODEL; C-12
AB Modification of the nucleon size in nuclear medium is discussed in terms of the omega-meson mass.  Vacuum polarization changes the omega-meson mass in nuclear medium and modifies the mean square charge radius of the proton by 3(1/m-omega-*2-1/m-omega-2), where m-omega-* and m-omega denote the omega-meson mass in nuclear medium and in free space, respectively.

TI EFFECT OF MOLECULAR-SIZE ON THE THRESHOLD ENERGY PRODUCING A CR-51 HOT
   ATOM
SO JOURNAL OF RADIOANALYTICAL AND NUCLEAR CHEMISTRY-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB The lowest retention values of Cr-51 hot atom in various forms of the-beta-diketone-type complexes, Cr(bzac)3, Cr(dpm)3 and Cr(dbm)3, as well as Cr(acac)3 as a reference, were obtained in the experimental condition in which they are regarded as the primary retentions.  From these retention values, the threshold energies for producing a hot atom, the "appearance energies", were estimated using the calculated relationship between the primary retention and appearance energy, which was obtained by the recoil energy spectra computed by the method recently developed by us.  The appearance energy increased steeply with increasing molecular weight of the complex.  A theoretical interpretation for this result was attempted by setting a model in which a hot atom is produced in the center of the complex and receives the stopping action by the surrounding ligand molecule.  The agreement between the observed and calculated values was good.
C1 RIKKYO UNIV,FAC SCI,TOSHIMA KU,TOKYO 171,JAPAN.
   RIKKYO UNIV,FAC SURG,TOSHIMA KU,TOKYO 171,JAPAN.

TI EXCITATION OF A PROGRESSIVE WAVE IN A FLEXURALLY VIBRATING TRANSMISSION
   MEDIUM
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 10TH SYMP ON ULTRASONIC ELECTRONICS ( USE 89 )
CY NOV 07-09, 1989
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, INST ELECTR INFORMAT & COMMUN ENGINEERS JAPAN, INST ELECT ENGINEERS JAPAN, INST TELEVIS ENGINEERS JAPAN, ACOUST SOC JAPAN, JAPAN SOC ULTRASON MED, JAPAN SOC NON DESTRUCT INSPECT, MARINE ACOUST SOC JAPAN, IEEE, ULTRASON FERROELECT & FREQUENCY CONTROL SOC, TOKYO CHAPTER
HO TOKYO INST TECHNOL
AB Excitation of a progressive wave in a straight and thin bar vibrating in the flexural mode can be utilized to construct a transport device such as a parts-feeder.  A new method to excite the progressive wave is proposed herein which has been proved possible by simulation and experiment.  Excitation of a progressive wave without utilizing the concept of impedance matching in a transmission line is done using two adjacent modes of flexural vibration.
C1 TOHOKU INST TECHNOL,DEPT COMMUN ENGN,SENDAI,MIYAGI 982,JAPAN.

HO TOKYO INST TECHNOL
AB This paper describes an improved model of the progressive wave type ultrasonic motor to explain the nonlinear characteristics due to the internal friction.  Some responses of motor speed to the applied voltage are calculated employing the proposed model.  The calculated results are compared with the measured results.

HO TOKYO INST TECHNOL
ID HEAT
AB The glass transition of glycerol was investigated by photoacoustic measurements, and the frequency dependence of photoacoustic signals was obtained by both a single frequency and the M sequence modulation.  The temperature dependence of the photoacoustic amplitude and phase were measured in the neighborhood of a glass transition temperature.  A shift of the glass transition temperatures with the modulation frequency was obtained.

TI EFFECT OF METAL COMPLEXATION ON THE BEHAVIOR OF LIQUID-CRYSTALLINE
   POLYMER
SO JOURNAL OF MACROMOLECULAR SCIENCE-CHEMISTRY
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT SEMINAR ON MACROMOLECULE-METAL COMPLEXES
CY JUL 23-28, 1989
CL LAWRENCEVILLE, NJ
HO RIDER COLL
ID MAIN CHAIN; SIDE-GROUP; ELASTOMERS
AB Liquid crystalline side-chain polymers (3b-3f) crosslinked by a trans Pt(II) complex were synthesized by a ligand exchange reaction with dichlorobis(benzonitrile)platinum(II) and poly(methylsiloxane) (3a) bearing a p-cyanobiphenyloxy mesogen unit attached to the polymer backbone by a flexible spacer group.  The amount (x) of p-cyanobiphenyloxy mesogen coordinating to the Pt(II) ion in polymers 3b, 3c, 3d, 3e, and 3f was 4.9, 9.7, 14.8, 20.2, and 49.6 mol%, respectively.  The effect of Pt(II) coordination on the thermotropic liquid crystalline behavior of 3a was examined by DSC, x-ray diffraction, and polarizing microphotography.  Polymers 3a-3d exhibited a nematic mesophase between T(g) and T(c).  On the other hand, 3e-3f, which have a large amount of Pt(II)-coordinating mesogen, did not show a definite nematic mesophase, but exhibited an ambiguous one.  The introduction of Pt(II) ion into 3a resulted in a crosslinked structure and consequently prevented the formation of the ordered nematic mesophase.

TI PERFORMANCE-TEST OF WASTE PACKAGE SYSTEM WITH BUFFER MATERIAL
SO JOURNAL OF THE ATOMIC ENERGY SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA Japanese
DT Article
DE ENGINEERED BARRIER; HIGH-LEVEL RADIOACTIVE WASTES; WASTE DISPOSAL;
   BUFFERS; WASTE PACKAGE SYSTEM; BUFFER MATERIALS; BENTONITE HEATER TEST;
   HEATING; THERMAL CONDUCTIVITY; SWELLING; THERMAL EXPANSION; WATER UPTAKE
AB A high level waste (HLW) package system with buffer material was designed considering a long-term storage system of the packaged waste in a repository.
   For the gamma-ray shielding, the buffer material of high density was prepared using bentonite powder and heavy sand of zircon.  The density of the dry buffer material was about 3 g/cm3.
   Heater test was carried out to study thermal characteristics of this buffer material and the waste package system.  The buffer material was heated by an electric heater which was set at the center of the package to simulate the decay heat generation of HLW.  The thermal conductivity of the buffer material was calculated from temperature distribution in the package.  It was found that the measured thermal conductivity of the buffer material vary with the electric power of the heater and the radial distance from the heater surface.  The thermal conductivity was in the range of 0.720 approximately 1.070 W/m.K at the electric power of the heater of 0.3 kW, and it was in the range of 0.685 approximately 1.410 W/m.K at 0.7 kW.  This is attributed to the water migration in the buffer material, caused by the heat flux.
   The changes of the swelling pressure and the water uptake rate in the buffer material was measured to study swelling pressure, water uptake rate and water diffusion coefficient of the buffer material by immersing double distilled water from the outside of the package.  Consequently the water diffusion coefficient in the buffer material was calculated to be 2.5 x 10(-10) m2/s.
